comment: This cable looked great and worked great, right up until the point it tried to burn my house down. I noticed my iPhone was getting a bit warm where the cable connects to the lightning jack. So I unplugged it thinking it was just a glitch in the iphone’s charging system. I left the cable on the floor.When I came from work 8 hours later, I found the melted blob pictured. I have no doubt that if I had left the cable on a flammable surface it would have started a fire.

Was great. Then it wasn't. 3 months later, it stopped charging. No kinks, no tears. Still in mint condition, but won't charge. I have original apple cords that are fraying that I've taped up with electrical tape that still work 2 years later.So frustrated with these cords. I thought if I spent more it would last longer. Bought 2 and both are broken. Maybe if I collect enough of them I can macrame a plant hanger with them.

I ordered this because the info indicated that this is an Apple Certified product. After 2 weeks of intermittent use (on a table in my living room) I got the dreaded “this accessory may not be supported” pop up. No worries... ish happens and I requested a replacement.  Received that today and I am getting the same pop up with the new cable. No other cable (both Apple and certified products) are doing this.  Add to this the fact that now I can only get an Amazon gift card as a refund.

I was very pleased with the quality of the product as I received it.  But after about one week of charging it became intermittent for a couple of days and then stopped working.  I think it is important to point out that this cord is in one location, I sit my phone on a table surface and let it charge all night.  So no moving, no using it while connected or such.  I also an not the type of person that unplugs it by pulling on the cored or such.  This just proved to me that they cord was either defective as received or poor quality (or maybe a combo of both).  Now it is much cheaper than an APPLE cord, but I would expect more.  Wish it would have done better....I had I hopes being an Amazon product!

Buyers beware! I had this cable for 5 days, last night phone was plugged in and I started to smell something like a burning plastic smell. I went to unplug the phone and the cable was EXTREMLY hot , hot enough to burn your hand when touching. When I went to unplug the cable from the phone I also received a shock from the end of the cable. Not suppose to happen!!

I needed a new lighting cord, especially a longer one (6 feet) so I bought this one in thoughts that the Nylon will make it last longer since that's the idea with nylon braided cables. At first sight and opening the package, it was seemed like it was good quality and it seemed like it was going to be promising but it actually doesn't work. I've plugged it into my charging block which came with my iPad and left it for an hour and when it was time to get up and go, I realized it only charged a couple percentages. Not too long after, it wouldn't even charge, nor would my phone even recognize that it was plugged in. I've used the regular iPhone charging block and nothing happened. I had to go back to using my old frayed cable for the mean time. I guess I just received a defective one?

I had high hopes for this lightning cable as the majority of the reviews were positive and mentioned that it didn't end up fraying after a short amount of time until it just stopped working or became unsafe to use. I use it with no problems for about 3 weeks, and then it started getting kind of temperamental about how the cable had to be positioned which made for some interesting solutions for charging my phone. Still, there was no obvious damage or fraying and the cord looked to be fine, so I continued to use it even if it was slightly annoying to sometimes have to spend some time finding the right position for the cable in order to charge my phone.About 3 1/2 weeks ago, I started noticing some obvious fraying of the braided cord near where it plugs into the iPhone and it inevitably became too temperamental to even bother using it to charge at all. I've now switched back to an Amazon Basics lightning cable and am hoping that one lasts longer than this one did.

I am very disappointed with this purchase. I bought AmazonBasics chargers for each of my family members in December and in March several of the chargers have stopped working are are not recognized by any of our numerous Apple devices. It's not an overuse issue as the one charger just sits in my office at work rarely used.
I was hesitant to buy this product but am quite pleased with it so far.Pros:

I've bought a few of these and each one is terrible. The problem is that they don't attach securely. Looking at them it is not possible for me to see the difference, but it's there and I regret buying them at any price. I have a few Anker cables and those are much better

I purchased this cord mid-January of 2019. It’s now the beginning of April, 2019, and it won’t charge my phone unless I hold it a certain way.There’s no visible wear and tear on the cord itself... It still looks brand new.

I purchased this charging cord right after my original Apple charger had broke.  I had gone with Amazonbasics, as they had always been a good brand with solid products, but this products is NOT the case.  The first time I purchased this, the cord did not work when i plugged it in. NOT at all.  It would not even charge my phone a bit. So, still with a bit of hope, I returned the cord for a replacement, And when my replacement came, it worked pretty good for a while, but only a month after I purchased the same cord a second time, it broke on em and stopped working COMPLETELY. I plan to return this product immediately to get my money back and to buy a charger DIRECTLY from Apples website.  DO NOT buy this cheap, knock off, TERRIBLE charger.  Just go buy the original charger from Apple.

I purchased this charging cable 3 months ago. Normally I go through these cables faster than anyone would want to. With this cable, however, it has withstood all of my "abuse" to it and constant use of it. I originally wanted to buy a wireless charger for my iphone XR but decided to go with this charging cable instead since it was longer than the usual cable I buy. What a great choice. This cable still works great to this day, no stripping or fraying of wires, no delay in charging time ... just a great choice overall. If you're thinking about purchasing this cable.. JUST DO IT

I have several of these lightening charging cords and really liked the idea of the cord being nylon braided thinking that they would be better than rubber ones.  Initially the cords worked just fine, but after time the ligthening connector becomes loose.  When the connection is loose the charging will start and stop at will, and many times you will have to unplug and replug the cord into the iPhone/iPad for the charging to restart.  I have even got the error message stating that this product is not supported.  The cord that comes with the Apple product works just fine every time (but the downfall of the Apple cords have a tendency to fray after time.)  When will there be a cord that we can use for more than a few months at at time before replacement?

I started off loving this cord, heavy duty, durable, the long cord was amazing. I've been using this for almost a year and it still looks good. I have to move it left and right and plug it in and unplug it just to try and get it to charge. It's frustrating. This wasn't always a problem, but now it is.Update: 11/06/17 - I've changed my rating from a 1 star to a 5 star. It turns out that there was very compacted pocket lint in the charger port.  I used a toothpick to clean out the port and it alleviated the problem.

It charges fine while it's plugged in, but keeping it plugged in is a hardship. The lightning end doesn't seat tightly, so it's constantly falling out.If you charge your phone in a way that doesn't have the cable being moved or jostled at all this should be fine. If you're like me and charge your phone with it next to you in bed or while using it then this is not the cable for you. Every cable I've ever used, Apple brand, Anker, or others the connection is very tight when seated - tight enough that you can safely dangle your phone from it. That is not the case here. Even just picking the phone up from the table with no tension on it often results in the connector falling out. I'd suggest sticking with the real thing or opting for a quality third-party like Anker.

I purchased this cable as a replacement for one of my stock apple cables that had worn out and I must say that I have been greatly impressed with it! The braided material of the cable gives it a more durable feel and seems to me that it will last for a decent amount of time. The actual plugs on either end are not overly large and thus are able to usually fit with most phone cases and USB charging bricks/hubs.One of the things that I really love is the customer service that you are able to receive for these cables. I purchased one of these cables previously and I had started having some issues with it. Once I contacted Amazon about the issue they sent me a new one free of charge and almost the next day!

This is the second time we've had an Amazon Basics lightning cable just stop working for no apparent reason. After the first time, I suspected it was the brand but we had had it for almost a year so tried to give the benefit of the doubt. Now I know for sure. We checked the outlet and other brands of cords still worked, we also checked it in multiple outlets, so it's definitely this lightning cable. Misleading too, because the cable would get plugged in, register momentarily (long enough for me to walk away assuming I was charging) and then just not work. VERY inconvenient when I was in a rush and grabbed what I assumed would be a fully charged device!

Got this to replace a similar "braided" iPhone charging wire that had become damage from abuse and neglect. It is long enough that I don't rip everything off the night stand while moving around and playing games on my phone while in bed. I've had no issues with the phone not picking it up or charging with it like some other replacement wires do. As with all of the Amazon Basics stuff it is well made and gets the job done. I'm looking forward to several years of hard abuse and neglect with this, and will replace it with the same when the time comes.  While this has nothing to do with performance, my coworkers often seek me out to use this to charge their own phones. "Where's that long charging wire" and "I want to use it" are the comments it receives most. My only suggestion would be to offer this in some bright non standard colors (safety orange, fluorescent pink, neon yellow or green) to both help me identify it as "mine" and to deter others from wanting to borrow it. Anyway, hope this review helps!

I came across this charging cable as a frustrated customer who seems to buy too many charging cables that only last a few weeks. I never want to spend the $30 on an Apple branded one because I feel like it’s not worth the money and the quality isn’t there with the Apple branded ones. I thought I’d give the Amazon Basics one a try because I’ve been surprised by the Amazon Basics products as the quality has always been really good with anything we have purchased. Long story short, I completely recommend this cable! This cable charges really fast, is durable and has lasted me already three months going strong. We have slowly been changing over all of our charging cables to the Amazon Basics branded ones.

I prefer these AmazonBasic phone chargers over the Apple chargers because of the length and price. The first one I bought was in Rose Gold and I loved it but roughly 3 weeks after purchasing was noticing there was a short somewhere. A few days later it had stopped working all together. I quickly purchased a second one in dark gray (no rose gold were in stock) and haven't had any issues with this new one. I love these chargers a lot but couldn't give it 5 stars because of how quickly the first one went bad.

I first purchased a few of these cords in spring 2018.  I was looking for an option that wouldn't crack & subsequently break where the lightning connector and the cord meet, as this was the reason I had to replace many prior apple cords.  Success!  It NEVER broke on any of the 6 cords I purchased.  However, a few weeks ago the cords started to have connection problems - the phone not always recognizing the product.  I thought it was because I had an older phone and just shrugged it off.  Then a few weeks before Christmas I got a new phone, and the problem persisted.  The past 2 weeks all of the cords stopped connecting, can't even get a partial charge by holding the charger in place.  *sigh* I guess things don't last forever do they?  I'm not sure if this was expected to last even two years, but I am not rough with things, so I am a bit disappointed they didn't last longer than they did.  Ordered replacements, they should be here in a couple of days.

This is perfect if you don’t want to spend too much on the Apple branded cord. I’m always worried the cord that isn’t made by them will only work for a short amount of time, especially when they are inexpensive, but this has been working well for a while and seems very durable and always works This is perfect if you don’t want to spend too much on the Apple branded cord. I’m always worried the cord that isn’t made by them will only work for a short amount of time, especially when they are inexpensive, but this has been working well for a while and seems very durable and always works

I bought this on a recommendation from a friend. Although hers is not made by AmazonBasics. So far it is doing what it should. Feels strong and well made. Charges as it should. I like the varieties in colors. I bought the rose gold. I’m in love with it. Has theAmazonBasics logo on the side of the piece that goes into my iPhone. I have an 8 plus and works and fits great. I’ve had it for several weeks now. If there are any changes I’ll update this review. For now, I personally recommend this charger. PS I bought the 3 foot.

Usually I am really happy with what I get from Amazon Basics... This would not be one of those times. The charger looked perfect and worked perfect... For like a week... then things started going wrong with it. The phone would get really hot when it charged, It would suddenly say it was not supported by apple... and I would move the phone around it would stop and start charging with every small move I made. I did not have a fire hazard like some people, but I did wake up to it being Very hot because my arm fell against it in the night. Unplugged it and tried it in the morning... It gets super hot. Not Messing with it again. I got one from Staples that looks identical but actually works like it's supposed to for around the same price.

Yikes. Just saw the plethora of negative reviews. Seems they’ve all had theirs longer than I have, so I’ll update if necessary, but here’s the scoop so far:Does what it’s supposed to do! Plugs into my charging-box thing! Charges my phone at a normal speed (read: I am happy with the speed my phone charges, you may not be! Different strokes and all that!)! Doesn’t break! Looks nice (though I failed to consider how potentially weird a gray cord plugged into a white charging-box thing might look, but that’s not the cord’s fault!)!

This is one of the best chargers I’ve ever had! I purchased 2 of these to replace off-brand car chargers that had seen better days. As always, this shipped immediately and I had it in 2 days.Pros: color, this is a really nice gray - has a Velcro closure on it to keep cord together when you wind up the charger - you can remove the Velcro closure if desired (and put it back on!!) - it’s super sturdy and durable, this can withstand everyday use without seeing wear and tear quickly - the price was GREAT for the quality of the product -  **<opinion> maybe it’s just me, but this charged my phone at the same speed or faster as the standard Apple charger that comes with the phone** - the cord is somewhat stiff and not as flimsy as the standard charger, it can (mostly) hold a shape when bent

Since my wife and I travel often, I wanted a long cord for use in motels and other places where outlets are not always as close as you wish. And, the cord that came with my iPhone now stays in my car for use there.  I have purchased Amazon Basics products in the past and have always found them to be of good quality.  Well, we are traveling and the extra length of this cord has come in very handy on several occasions. The nylon braiding appears of high quality and long-lasting material.  I didn't grade the Durability because I've only had it about a month but believe it will last.

There is several reasons why I keep buying this cord, and brand! First off, I wanted something that was not flimsy and needed something that will hold up to some wear and tear, being in a pocket or a back pack. After some research, because I don't just purchase something without reading accurate reviews from people, I settled with this brand. Reasons being it is rugged looking and feeling, it comes wrapped up in a little flimsy type cardboard box, but who cares, the cord itself had this layer of braided nylon that gives it a little more extra help on the times it may be tugged on. They have a variety of options for length from 10ft to 3ft. I have bought several kinds of length and I have never had one issue as of yet, and it's been probably several years of having one to a few weeks to my newest one that I keep in each vehicle to charge and connect to my car's radio. It charges pretty quickly, so it's definitely holding up to its "lightning" charging capabilities. I would highly recommend this cord to anyone looking for a replacement.

It surely feels like it will hold up. Only time will tell. Maybe I should have given it to my teenage son for a REAL torture test! At any rate, if it fails in any way within a year, I'll update. It stays in my car so it will be exposed to temperature changes, uv rays, and non-ventilated flatulence.A year has passed and no update is necessary. Wait... what did I just do then?😳

This cable was good for some time but after about 4 months it broke. I sent amazon an email explaining the situation and the immediately responded saying they would send me another one without even having to send them back the broken cable. It shipped immediately and works great. Overall, decent  cable but amazing customer service.

This works poorly in transferring data from my iPhone 7 to my 2015 Nissan Frontier. For example, transferring my iTunes from phone to truck via this cord gets stuck at 1 % transferred. I never had this or any other problems with the Havit cord I wore out over three years previously.  I’m going back to a new version of the Havit—but I probably won’t be buying it via Amazon.

It was working great but on the tenth day the cable started to peel of a little on the charger side and eventually stopped working. I totally forgot about it to return and the 30-day return period crossed.

This is the only lightning cable I've ever used that hasn't worn down and continues to work. I've never gotten an incompatible accessory warning on my iPhone with this cable. This will be the only lightning cable I purchase from now on. I have taken this cable to Hawaii, to Thailand, all over the United states.....In checked bagged, in carry ons....This cord has held up through all of it. And continues to work perfectly. This cord has seen 4 iPhones....All of this use since May 2017..I think the people that have had negative things to say about this cable are probably the ones who have poor luck with phone cables in the first place. Some people just break and wear them out faster than others. This cable has lasted me forever. Amazon did an amazing job wit this cable. I will be buying more.

I used to buy the older model amazon basics charger but one of the weaknesses of phone chargers in general is that  it starts breaking down and exposing the wires where the plastic sheeth meets the plastic male end. This charger however appears to be sturdier as it has a braided sheeth and where it meets the plastic it is thicker and has more rubber surrounding where it meets the male end. I bought 2 to replace failing chargers and will probably end up buying more for my family of iPhones.

I ordered these cables to see if they would last longer than the original cable that comes with the phone and they do.  The overall construction is better and pull points are more robust.  The apple cables will start to pull away near the end close to the lightning connection but these cables do not.  I ordered in 6 and 3 ft.  Our office employees all like them too,  highly recommend.  These cables are not as thin as the apple cable so if you are one who likes ultra thin and very pliable, they are thicker and more stiff hence the better construction.  I would highly recommend..

I bought this iPhone lightning cable from Amazon thinking it would be different but I am really dissatisfied with the purchase. After 100 charges, the lightinging connector was not getting snug contact with my iPhone. So, sometimes when I pick up my iPhone to check whether it has finished charging, I inadvertently pop the connection loose. I am wondering what is going to happen after prolonged use.

Lightening cable for the iPhone - pretty standard, definitely functions and charges my phone when I plug it in.  I've had it for almost 7 months, and it still works perfectly.  The braided cable is probably the best invention ever.  In addition to the wire being stronger this way, it doesn't knot up as easily and the stiffness keeps it more in place and out of the way.  Great product, definitely better than buying new Apple ones.

We've all experienced the infuriating splitting with the standard charging cords (even with just basic gentle use). I've been using my first nylon cord for over a year and there are not even any signs of damage. I've since purchased several more, and will never again so back to the basic cords. I've never had a problem with the AmazonBasics cords not working as they should.

If you're like me, despite your best efforts, your iphone charger probably just broke. Again if you're like me, you probably handled it with what any reasonable person would call care, and yet somehow, it's managed to be frayed beyond recognition and finally gave out a few hours ago.So now you're on the search for something stronger, you think to yourself you want to buy a better cable this time, not and not just something a little better, you want something MUCH STRONGER, it needs to be made out of metal and braided nylon so strong you could walk on it like a tightrope in your spare time!

Cord quality is sturdy. The cord would seemingly last until hell freezes over! But this sturdiness comes at a big price -- the cord kinks easily, is almost impossible to coil -- so this is the downside. I've read about problems with the lightning connector, but so far I haven't encountered any problems with it -- knock on wood. Frankly if I were buying another cord I would not buy this one.

Gotta say I'm a huge fan of Amazon and even their Amazon Basics stuff is made pretty well, but this cable has officially died on me. I bought this cable way back in May of this year. I bought it to leave at work, should I ever need to charge my phone there. I had used it occasionally and only just recently had I really noticed how slow it charged. With in the last couple of weeks I would plug my phone into charge for the ride home from work and realized that it hadn't really been charging at all. I've used it little over 10 times and it really only ever worked around 3 times early on. Now as I'm writing this review I have it plugged into my computer and still no luck. What a bummer.
Apple cerified my a**. It says it's not compatable now after a few weeks of use.

I have never been more disappointed in a product, and this was the first time that I have ever been disappointed with Amazon. The cord only worked for a few days- if that. I received it Wednesday afternoon. Put in my car Thursday, and hooked my phone up to it Thursday and Friday. Did not notice if it was charging or not (because my phone was almost fully charged anyway) until Saturday, when my phone was almost dead, and my son was  in the middle of a severe ALLERGIC REACTION, and I was trying to talk to someone about what to do, and it went dead. It was not charging at all. I would return, but I do not want to go through the process for it. I am frustrated since I purposely picked the Amazon Basics brand thinking it would  be more reliable than other off brands. So not only did it not work, it was a very inconvenient time for it not to work.I know it was the cord- it hooks directly to the USB port, and when I got another cord, it charged my phone fine.

Purchased a number of these...usually last a few months before noticeable ‘burn’ marks. the Apple Store genius said the iPad ends all had signs of arcing, leading to ‘unsupported usb device’ error message and failure to charge.  In fact, the battery failed and the iPad replaced.  How much faulty cables contributed to this failure is unknown.The construction of mesh, wire and rubber strain relief is fine, connectors not.  Search for cables that last more than a few months continues.

I bought this charger for higher than the cost of most other chargers because I figured the nylon braiding would keep the cable from deteriorating and eventually breaking -- surprisingly, it still broke after only a little over a month of use! It showed no signs of wear, what I'm betting is that the braiding doesn't actually protect the cable -- just protects you from seeing it breaking down. Very disappointed, I'm tired of buying new chargers.
Bought 2. One has never worked and says "this accessory may not be supported". Other works fine half the time. 50% I guess. Sucks waking up to a dead phone.

UPDATE: While I initially reported that I had some issues with this cable, I changed the charging block and that solved the problem. I don’t want to jinx myself but I’m going on 11 months with this cable without any issues.I placed my first order for Amazon Basics charging cables (standard white in 6 ft length) for my family’s Apple products in June 2016. They started failing in August 2017. I was happy with getting more than a year out of them, especially considering the price compared to genuine Apple products. So I ordered three more; two six foot and a ten foot. Both six foot failed within two months. Then I bought this one. I figured having a braided cable with reinforced plastic around the common point of failure, where the cable meets the adapter into the phone, would give better performance. Nope. I’ve had it two days and it has already done that thing where it cuts the charge off and on repeatedly.

Like many people, I have gone through a lot of these cords - they wear out too quickly. This is the third type of cord that is braided and more flexible. These tend to last longer and handle more being scrunched up and stuffed in cases than the other two I bought.This is an Amazon brand, "AmazonBasics". I am becoming more familiar with their product line and so far, have found it to be as good, if not better, than other name brands I have bought. Mostly, the quality is better and their prices are competitive.

after 2 months of using it ended damaging my iphone 7 plus. So I had to go to apple and thank god they replace my 5 months phone for a new one. I never had any issues with amazon products, but i wont buy amazon cables any more, at least no for expensive items.

I bought these to charge my iPhone 8 in my car and to connect to my laptop to drag and drop photos and videos.  They work perfectly in both these capacities.  I have purchased cheap knock off cables before that actually don't work, or don't work reliably, so believe it or not it actually IS possible to screw up a cable haha.  These are wonderful.  I have had nothing but good experiences with Amazon Basic products before and these are no exception!  I can definitely recommend!

After the Power Struggle in my house (Pun intended), my husband was closer to burning our apartment down than letting go of that horrible apple cable that was shredding to pieces. I bought this as a way of keeping us safe, but I never thought he'd love them so much. I ordered 2 and my case wouldn't let the cable fit, so I was going to return the second one... My husband had other plans for it. So in other words, it's durable and tough enough to survive a mechanic head doing work on engines and using the cable like its security blanket aka the normal wear and tear of being moved around a lot!.

I bought this cord in April 2019 and loved it until...last week my brand new iphone 11 Pro Max was almost ruined by it!  Started getting a message on my phone that liquid was detected in charging port.  My phone had not been anywhere close to water.  Also, it would not charge.  Started investigating.  Tried the Amazon cord on my iPad and it would not charge that either.  Looked on line and saw that dust or debris in charging port can trigger liquid error message.  I blew out the charging port and noticed that the end of the Amazon cable had dirt and like a greasy film all over it.  I tried another Apple cord and it came out of my phone with the same dirt and fuzz.  Cleaned off all of my Apple cords and thank goodness, they now work perfectly.  The last thing that I needed in a Pandemic is a phone that cannot charge.  I would not waste my money on this cord...it is not worth a possible ruin to an expensive iPhone!!
Broke after about 6 months and stopped charging.  Plus, the lightning connecter is so fat it wouldn't fit well in my case well.Bummed, because usually amazon basics are pretty well designed.

This cable is very durable and feels well put together. There are some rubber reinforcements at both ends where these cables normally break and those add extra rigidity in that area. Overall i recommend these over the apple lightning cable and the amazon basics cable that isnt nylon braided.

The cable braiding was top notch. Felt like it wouldn’t fray or fall apart like the Apple brand lightning cables do after a year. BUT the connection into the phone would never firmly stay in place. If I was driving with the phone sitting on my Spigen car mount the Amazon brand cable would fall out of the phone after a couple heavy bumps no matter how hard I pushed the jack in. I had bought 2 cords and both had this problem. I decided to replace with a brand I knew to be top notch  branding and didn’t fall out while driving.When I used the Amazon brand at home my phone would keep chiming that it was connected then it was disconnected. I just through both away and replaced with Anker brand for 5$ more.

I recently purchased my third one so I feel like I have a pretty good opinion formed. I love the length, and I like that it’s braided because it feels like it will last longer. However, it doesn’t actually last longer than any other lightning cable I’ve ever owned. I bought two at first, one for my wife and one for myself. Mine first started to short after about 3 months. I’m generally pretty hard on things so we both thought that it was probably just me being too rough with it. However, my wife’s started to short about a month later and she never breaks things like I do.  By the time hers shorted I had already purchased a replacement for mine.  If it had happened earlier I would have gone a different route. The Apple cables still last longer than anything else I’ve owned.  However, I like the length that you can get from a third party cable.  I thought this would finally be the cable to give me both length and longevity of use, but it disappointed like the rest. If you just want a long cable find a cheaper option and just replace them often, because this one will short on you almost just as fast and you’ll spend more money on it.

Do not buy this product!!!!  This is your fair warning.I charged my iPhone for the first time overnight with my new charger and when I woke up my phone was burning hot.  I immediately took it off the charger, but the damage was done.  Someone tried to call me and the phone was no longer able to accept incoming calls.  It could very slowly send and receive texts but only if they didn't have photos or GIFs.  It remained burning hot all day even when I wasn't using it and it was not on a charger.  The phone started losing battery percent ridiculously fast once off the charger.  When I tried to use my other charger that has never given me a problem, the phone started to get extremely hot again.  My neighbor used to work at the Apple Store so I took it over for him to look at.  He confirmed that the charger fried my phone and the reason it was so hot, even when not on the charger, is because the phone is working too hard to process even the simplest thing.  He said never to buy a charger for an iPhone except directly from Apple or this could happen.

The braiding on the cord is nice, however, the cord won't stay plugged into the phone so it's irrelevant how durable it is.I have been using them for a little over a month. I bought 3 different cords (two at 3 feet & one at 6 feet) and they all have the same defective issue. They work if you plug the cord in and don't touch the phone at all, however, any sort of movement of the phone causes the cord to fall out and stop charging. It makes them pointless if you plan on using the cords while walking around with the phone in a bag or if you are using the phone while charging.

These look like hi quality but don't be fooled.  If you see the ribbed part just before the plug. Well, thats the weakest point and.in no time (a few months) connection was getting real iffy unless cord was kept straight out the back! Really surprised me given that Amazon Basics parts are high quality. Sorry Amazon, not this one.

Having gone through three of Apple's power cables in the year since I bought my iPad due to the notoriously flimsy connector at the Lightning end of the cable, I came looking for *anything* with better construction. This cable is brilliant, plain and simple. The connections at both ends are designed to completely eliminate the flexing issue that causes Apple cables to separate from the business ends. and the braided nylon sheathing promises to make the entire cable last longer. Great design, low price. Way to go, Amazon!
This cord has been very dependable and consistent. No issues with charging. Length is perfect for bed side or tv viewing while charging. No issues.  Would buy again

Amazon CS will be hearing from me as well; however, buyer BEWARE. This device is exceedingly poorly made. When I removed the cord from my iPad charging port, the tip that covers the charging pins SNAPPED OFF and is now STUCK inside my iPad's charging port. I can't get it out, which means I will have to take my iPad in for repair in order to be able to use my charging port. I have two other cords like this that I bought for my children to use, and their use stops now.If I don't get my $ back, my decade + relationship with Amazon will be finished. I'm beyond livid that this POS Amazon Basics product is the reason I'll now have to incur money and time and travel costs to have my iPad port repaired.

I've been using this daily for several months and I love it. After going through a number of off brand and Apple cords that either stopped working or just broke, this was a pleasant surprise. I got the thickest one thinking it would be less likely to crack when bent or twisted. This probably isn't the cable for constant travel and needing to cramp it as small as possible since it doesn't fold or crease. It just works, holds its shape, and isn't going to fall apart.

I noticed my OEM cords were looking a little beat and after Amazon basics has proven itself with batteries and other electronic peripherals I gave these a shot. I swear my phone charges faster! I also don't fear the dreaded kink or breakage right by the lightning plug as the braided cable is very sturdy and the connections are all reinforced.Really can't complain at all. They work great and the price is reasonable

The size is perfect for when i'm charging my phone with a battery pack. Too short for charging in the wall for me. But great for on the go charging because its not too long. The wrapped cord is also a plus. I've had it for a year and haven't been trying to keep it nice. And it looks like how it did when i first purchased it. Hopefully it will last forever.

I have received three of these chargers. First time was when I purchased one for my mother last year and it worked great.Second time was this July for myself. It was fine at first but it stopped working recently and it’s only been less than two months (it’s September now). Of course, I called costumer service and they offered to send a replacement which I agreed to. Well the replacement arrived this week on Wednesday and stopped working the very next day on Thursday night...

I’ve been using this product for over a year now, and I was so excited about the durability. I never noticed any real issues until about a month ago. My newish phone has been overheating like crazy every time I charge it, even though I’m careful about how I use it. Today, I noticed that the USB end of the cable wear it meets the power converter (I use the standard Apple block which came with the phone) was ridiculously hot and had patches of discoloration. I don’t mess with overheating electronics, so I’m throwing it away immediately. Hopefully my phone doesn’t have permanent damage; I’m just glad I noticed before my bedroom caught on fire. I’d definitely say you should avoid this product as I believe it poses a substantial risk for a fire.

Bought this because I kept going through charging cables in my car. I don't take the cables out of the car so they just sit and bake in the Florida sun all day, plus sometimes the cords got wrapped around my e-brake or gear shift. So usually after a few months or so, my cable would stop working (even if I treated it like gold it's entire lifespan) and I got tired of it. A friend of mine told me braided cables are the way to go because they don't bend funny ways and they have a little more "give" to them. Bought this and I'm a happy camper!

I should have realized this would be a bad charger when it would not charge my phone while the cord was plugged into my macbook. I've only had it a couple of days and used it a handful of times and the charger no longer charges my phone in any outlet. I have tried using other iphones and it does not charge those either.I really wanted to like this charger, it's a great price and it LOOKS like good quality. But it is not a quality charger at all.

I currently have 4 of these cables, all purchased between Nov 2016  and June 2018. Unlike the original Apple cables, all of them are still in mint condition by appearance. However, at this point, two of the oldest cables are no longer working properly. Both have worked for me without an issue for about two years.  As such the one purchased in:Aug 2017

This is the only lightning cable i’ve owned that has failed.  It lasted a little over three months and now connects erratically.  Even if it is connected, the connection can be lost at any moment. Very frustrating to wake up in the morning and realize my iPhone was not charging overnight.

I really wanted to like this product so many of the other plastic/rubber coated (including the product called the Unbreak cable) have not lasted under actual use conditions  Although it looks fine it seems they have difficulty talking to my iPhone many of the cables I purchased, this one caused the typical error message after telephone os update (This accessory may not be supported). Although it does in fact charge the phone not too fast or not to slow the inconsistency of the charger remaining plugged in is a problem. Those who have an iPhone are familiar with the little tone that it plays when it’s plugged in or unplugged Those who have an iPhone are familiar with the little tone that it plays when it’s plugged in or unplugged.  This goes on every few seconds on and off all night long 2 notes up the scale, 2 notes down the scale. Be boop up, Be boop down.  However if I turn the volume off of my phone although I don’t hear the tones I also don’t hear any incoming calls nor can I use the alarm. I have taken my phone and all the chargers to the Genius Bar at Apple I thought perhaps my jacket might need to be replaced however they informed me that in fact the jack was fine proved it to me by plugging in several of my different cables and showing that they turned on OK. (They didn’t even charge me since they didn’t fix anything or replace anything and could find nothing wrong)

Super disappointed with this charger, it works, but it doesn't work well.  The first time I used it I left it charging for about an hour without checking it.  Came back to unplug it, sure it would be at 100% only to find it had gone from 25% to 37%.  I've had it plugged in beside me at work for 30 minutes and it's literally only gone up 1%.  Basically now I use it only to make sure it doesn't die, but don't expect to get any real charge out of it.

This works perfectly, and I’m very glad to  have something longer than my original that came with the phone. I’ve had other chargers that will stop with a message that the device is not supported, but I’ve never had that issue with this one. The fabric texture around the cord is a nice feature and the Rose gold color is cute. It’s a little stiff, so it holds its shape. Overall I like it and have considered getting another for my husband’s night stand. It’s the cable only and I plug it into the wall adapter from my original charger.

I’ve had this charger for 3 years now. I was just thinking about how every other charger (especially apples) have either broken or stoped working by now. I am super impressed! It doesn’t have anything wrong with it even after all this time:) very happy!

Worked great for 2 days.Over the years we have used several different brands of aftermarket chargers and cords for our iPads and iPhones. We always have the same problems. They work good for a few days/weeks, then they get finicky. This is the first time we used Amazon Basic and I expected it to be a better quality than other cheap brands. Unfortunately, I was wrong.

Like many others, I got these cables thinking more expensive and heavier duty... these should last longer.  I purchased the 3ft and 6ft cables in rose gold.  I seemed to have fared better than most, because my cables lasted just over a year before they stopped charging (right after the warranty expired wouldn't you know).  The cables are physically in great shape and show no signs of wear or fraying (see photo).  Seemed like a shame to throw out cables that still looked this good.I can not recommend as I've had better luck with the basic lightning cables.  I'm giving it three stars only because it outlasted the 1 year warranty.  For the extra cost, I was hoping for more durability.  If you want the look and find that a year of use is acceptable for the price, then you should be happy with these cables.  For my money, I'll stick with the basic lightning cables.

This arrived right on time and the rose gold color looks exactly like it is shown online. I bought this to use for my iPhone 6s and it has worked great for me so far. I have learned how important it is to get a charger cable for my iPhone that is Apple MFi Certified because I bought one in the past that wasn't and it made my phone battery not last as long after being charged and then it completely stopped charging my phone at all after a few weeks. This charger from Amazon Basics has worked perfectly since I got it in the mail. It chargers my phone quickly and I got the 6 foot cable that works well when I need to use my phone while charging it. I like the color and the braided cord seems tougher than the normal iPhone cable. I would definitely recommend this product to anymore looking for a new iPhone cable.

Ive never purchased Amazon basics items before. And I won't do it again.  It's already starting to cause the phone charge intermittently, see lightning flicker. Amazon sent a replacement. But how many more cables will break from not even a month of usage ?

I bought a few different cables awhile back to see which one(s) tended to hold up under my daily iPhone 6+ use.  Gotta say, this cable has shown no sign of the fraying or coming-apart on the lightning connector end other cables have.  It's a bit stiffer, but I've found I like that.  Yeah I'd buy this one again.  I have several cats, and they haven't done any damage to this cable either.  That's a first.

I have bought numerous nylon braided cords on Amazon.  Every other one stops working within 3 months.  Some had to be situated a special way to make contact with the port.  Some caused my Apple products to later display an "not compatible" message.  Strangely enough, the cords worked were compatible for at least 2 months without difficulty.  I did everything I could to unplug and replug and sometimes, it would work, and then the day came when the trick was a no go.  A friend told me about Amazon nylon braided cords.  I have now used them for 1 year and they are still going strong.  Never had an error message and you don't have to align your device just right.  My now go to cord

I received my cable on Wednesday and have been trying to use it since. I am very confused by the wire because it does not charge my products? Sometimes when I plug it in to my wall adapter (which was purchased from apple) and it does not charge. In the corner of my product (iPad Mini 5th Gen, iPhone X), it will say "not charging". Other times, it will display the charging symbol but the battery life will not go up. Instead, it keeps it at a constant. For example, if my battery is at 76%, it will stay at 76% and not move at all even though it says that it is charging and has been charging for at least an hour.I had really great hopes for this charger because my roommate has the same exact one and really likes it. The length is perfect and I really like the velcro that is attached to it. I just wish it charged my products because that is what I bought it for...

Pretty good quality cable. I’m notoriously (and usually unintentionally) rough on all my devices and accessories, so I often run into problems when things break prematurely. This cable lasted me almost exactly a year before I began experiencing the usual cable-only-works-when-you-hold-it-like-this problem, which began about a week ago for me. I keep my main phone cable connected to a power adaptor snaked up through my headboard (probably terribly unsafe, i know) and charge my phone in my bed, so it’s been through a year of tangles, awkward angles, twists, bends, and the like. The braided cord is definitely a good durability feature and keeps it intact as you bend & twist the cable with what I would consider everyday use.  I was, of course, disappointed when I witnessed the first signs of distress last week as my phone rapidly connected & disconnected from charge when I held my phone a certain way. However, checking back at when I placed the order for it, I saw that I had just passed the year mark and didn’t feel so bad about it.Good quality cable - it survived a year with me. Worth your money for sure.

It is as described except for the color.  The colored metal at the end near the plugs is slightly rose gold but remaining cord parts are a light pink.  Wasn’t a deal breaker for me since it’s just an overnight charger for me.  I am impressed with quality. The cord is covered with a tight nylon braid. The ends are securely fastened with rubber like ends which blend into the colored metal house for the silver tone connectors (sorry, not sure of the technical terminology). I’ve only used the cord a couple times but it is quick to charge.  In all, it seems to be good purchase

I purchased 2 of these cords in May 2018, the first cord didn’t keep its charge after 3 months of use so I pulled out the second cord and it has lasted me until last week. I finally got the “accessory not supported” message. It was just so frustrating. Now I’m in search of another cord. I feel like it’s getting to the point where I need to spend the extra money for a warranty or just stick with the original overpriced, not so durable Apple accessories. Just to have the confidence of purchasing a reliable product. Instead I have to sift through reviews trying to decide if this is the right product for me or will it be another unreliable inconvenience.

This worked fine for about a month then it would only charge my phone if plugged in with a particular side facing the front of the phone, then it stopped working to charge my phone altogether. It was only ever plugged into a normal household outlet. Other cords plugged into that outlet have been fine. Very disappointing that it failed so soon.

The cable worked for over a year.  Then it stopped working.  So I bought a different brand to replace it and that one is fine.  You do the math on price/value and see if that's good enough for your needs.  But you might want to have a spare cable on hand, just in case.  (Had essentially the same experience with another one of this brand in a different color, too).

I keep these things everywhere. I have 2 in each vehicle one on my tool box at work. Never had an issue with any of them. Yet. The one at work probably takes the most abuse because it’s on top of my box so when I bring a handful of tools back it’s typically gets smashed a couple times a day for the last 2 years. Still works.  I couple these with the “rsvpower” cigarette lighter dual usb plug and they charge pretty fast and hardly stick out  of the cigarette lighter for a clean look. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07K6F5YHV/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awdb_btf_t1_fJJpFbJW2H8N3

There are lots of companies that make cables for our beloved electronics, however, not all of them are safe (MiFi certified),  made of quality materials, or inexpensive. I have come to trust AmazonBasics to fulfill my electronic cable needs because they fit all 3 feature requirements for me above. I have a lot of the standard plastic cables for years that are still in good condition. I now prefer the braided cable style because I feel they are more flexible so I was happy to see Amazon makes braided cables now too. Go ahead and give these a try. Amazon stands behind their products so if you aren't happy with them I'm sure they will take care of you to ensure your satisfaction.

So my family has a lot of electronic devices, mostly iPhones and iPads. The original lightning cable gets frayed easily and is limited by its very short length. AmazonBasics provides a much longer charging cable with the added durability and aesthetics with the braided nylon threads. I keep two of these in my car as my dual charger is in the backseat and these easily reach to the front driver and passenger area. These are also great for traveling, as they are easy to wind up and pack with the attached (and removable) hook and loop tie.

UPDATE - 9 months, and so far so good.  the long plastic cuff just split, but the underlining braided part is fine, and the normal stress point is still fine.  And I’m reeeaaallly hard on cords.ORIGINAL:  Only had it a few weeks, but so far the quality - especially at the stress point where the head meets the wire that they ALWAYS seem to fray - seems far above any other cord I’ve seen.  I keep a cord at my desk, downstairs and bedside, and plan on replacing the other 2 with this when they need it.  (Which they will... every cord I’ve had seems to have a max 6m lifespan...)

I ordered the rose color. The first one didn’t work at all straight out of the box. Amazon sent a replacement and the second one is clearly defective. I keep getting that constant dinging noise where it try to work, but then it doesn’t. I have had Amazon chargers in the past that haven’t had issues, but this is a bad batch and Amazon needs to know that! I will try it in another color to see if it was just a bad batch with the rose color.

Bought 2 for home and car for my iPhone 8. When plugged in if it moved it would stop charging. This happened the very first time I used it. Then it progressed to stopping and starting constantly on its own even when not touched. I had to check to see if it finally stopped on charging mode. And if it wasn’t, jostle it until it starts charging. Bought another one from target and the same thing happened. So it’s possible that these are non certified chargers or something may be wrong with the phone. Will update if I figure it out.Update: It was the phone.😐

A wonderful charging cable. Quality item.  Sturdy and well made. Would recommend to everyone.Update:  Have to take away 3 Stars.  It cost twice as much as any of my other cables and didn't last half the time.  After using it only about 2 dozen times (and never used the phone while it was plugged in) it suddenly quit charging. It was basically only used while doing IOS updates and back-ups.  I have no idea why.  No visible wear or damage to the cable.  Seems to be in the tip that goes in the phone.  It isn't dirty or worn and the phone still charges on all of my other cables.

Cable is good overall, not indestructible. After 2 years I’m throwing the one that comes with me everywhere out. The rubber holding the cord at both ends is loose, somewhat tacky (sticky) and falling apart. It has however held up far better than the OEM ones and other non-braided cords. It helps that I have cords where ever I go, to reduce wear and tear. I have one at home, in the car, and one at work. The ones that don’t move around or get tossed into a bag are faring better. I might try a different style to see if the connection at the ends last longer though.

I have a puppy who loves to chew cords and a husband that tends to leave things laying out, so I have purchased more of these than I care to admit. Each time, the cord has worked right away and I have never had an issue using it on an iPhone 8, X, or 11. I have also used it on an iPad Air 2 and newer iPad Air. The device has always been recognized and has charged well, and none of the cords have ever stopped working on their own. One cord lasted me 3 years in college before we got our dog. I will keep buying these as long as I need them.
My phone goes haywire sometimes while it’s charging. I feel robbed.

Okay, so it seems like a good cable, potentially durable, with thought going into making the joins between cable and plug ends etc. However, 2 out of 3 very quickly stopped working and I’ve had to go an buy the more expensive OEM versions once more.Qualification/clarifications: This is why I’ve given 2 stars rather than 1.

My Apple iPhone charger started falling apart per their design to make us by more. I noticed after I taped it that my phone stopped charging right. Of course I figure ok time for new charger. Picked up the gray 6ft one last week. Was super excited plugged in my phone and come to find out it’s actually my phone acting up. Long as I have the charger in just right it charges. I have used this with the apple block, a laptop (ituns totally picked up the phone and was going to let my sync not all third party chargers will do this.) I used it on a tower and a portable charger. The laptop and tower both charged slower as normal and the iPhone charger and certified power charge that’s also rapid work perfect. So far nothing’s hot I leave this plugged in for hours. Long as you are using it correctly you shouldn’t have any problems. I’ll update if after a few weeks it stops working as I saw others complain happened.

Update: I originally posted a 2-star review, stating that I thought the charger was causing my phone to press buttons randomly. After finding a new charging block, this charger works perfectly as it should, so I’ve bumped the review up to a 5. I’m still not sure what the issue was for the first week or so, but I’m happy to say I’ll be back to buy another charger once this one dies.I bought this charger a while back then replaced it with the same one once the first got to the end of its life. I love the length and the strength of the cord itself. However, whenever the newer charger is plugged into my phone, the phone goes crazy and does whatever it wants - scrolls, opens apps, likes and follows pages on social media... the old charger did the same, but only at the end of its life. I figured it was just my phone or the block, but the craziness doesn’t occur unless it’s plugged into this charger. I tested with multiple blocks.

So I really like these - I was tired of continuing to buy the typical lightening cables (white or black) that are coated plastic. We are a family of 6 and chargers and cables tend to wear our quickly (frayed connections) and I wanted something that would be durable and look good enough to be plugged in most of the time. So far, these have really exceed my expectations. The cables are wrapped with a strong nylon-like weave, they are still flexible (one of my original worries) and actually look nice (I got the gray’ish tinted ones). No issues with them fitting snuggly into my existing chargers nor into the Apple devices themselves. I highly recommend them.

This baby is heavy duty. Longer than most which is what I was looking for. The nylon braiding is great. I’ll probably buy this kind when I need more since we’re hard on cords. Edited to note: the phone end of this is metal and a little wider than the Apple cord. I have a bit of difficulty plugging it into my phone with the case that wraps around my phone. It’s just a wee bit large for some cases. I’ve been known to trim the plastic around cords that are like this. Nope-metal, lol. Didn’t really want to try and mess with the metal. It’s a great quality cord though, I’ve bought 2 so far.

I got the idea of using a longer cable from our niece and nephew when they visit to charge and stay on their phones.  We have an older home and there's not as many outlets.  These work great when we are using our iPad Pros on the couch.  There's plenty of length so you can sit comfortably.  However, we later upgraded to a different brand.  These lasted about four months, the. The iPads quit recognizing the cords and we would get pop ups that said they were not compatible

My original iPhone charger wore out, and I needed a replacement. I wanted something durable that didn’t cost an arm and a leg. This charger is perfect! It works just as expected and charges my phone fast. The braided nylon is durable and I never have to worry about the cord stripping and becoming a fire or electric shock hazard. I like this cord so much that I bought two additional ones for other Apple devices in my home, and a couple to give as gifts. I highly recommend this cord if you need a replacement charger for your iPhone or iPad but don’t want to pay a ridiculous amount for it.

As our family has a small "fleet" of iPhones, these cables have proven to be a decently-priced substitute for the OEM cable. The braided shielding provides durability, both in the car and (somewhat) against our lovable but sometimes destructive house cats. Charging is just as good as OEM, and the additional length adds to the usability. These have been our "go to" cables when we need a USB to Lightning cable.

I was looking for a decent braided charging cable since the ones that already come with new iPhone don't last that long either. I bought a pack of two to try them out. They worked great, then after 3 months later, it stopped charging. No kinks, no tears. Still in mint condition, but won't charge. I thought if I spent more it would last longer. Bought 2 and both are broken.

The material is great, much stronger and more durable than the actual Apple brand cables. Unfortunately, when I tried to use it in my car to both charge and play music, there was an incessant popping noise accompanying the audio. I thought it might just be an issue with the podcast I was listening to, but I switched back to my Apple cable (which, mind you, is almost completely disintegrated, a common problem with Apple cables) and the podcast played with perfect audio. I thought it might be an issue with the cable and my audio system, but my audio system is standard issue for my 2014 vehicle (not aftermarket). I’ve never had this issue with any other cable despite how much usb iPhone cables disintegrate. Seems like this product is fine enough for charging, but I would be weary using it for audio as well as data transfer (backing up your phone, transferring photos, etc). It seems like they skimped on reliable data transfer on this one. I bought two of them specifically for charging purposes only, but I bought another one meant to be used in the car, and I will likely be returning it as a result of its poor audio performance.

Was the 6’ $12 plus beige cable was non functional within 3 weeks and not used frequently enough or abused in any way.  It was actually used a total of less than a dozen times and not moved from the i n wall plug more than 4 -5 times. Unfortunately  I was unable to process a return due to travel. However I did want to comment to save someone else from the same mistake I made. Amazon’s choice of vendors who supply substandard products with the cheapest materials and little to no quality control has driven me to web shop from individual merchants who’s sales volume and bottom line is heavily impacted by customer dissatisfaction and return business.This particular product had all the right looks and claims but I’ll shop elsewhere.  Plastic or nylon housing can cover up numerous manufacturingsins. So many ‘amazon’ products I’ve bought have this issue and I feel the responsibility for quality control among amazon ‘s choice of vendors and/or manufactured products (especially those with the amazon’s logo) is squarely amazon’s responsibility. My choice to use a lower case ‘a’ when mentioning amazon was purposeful ; not a typographical error.

We have been using amazon cables to charge our iPhones for many years. They usually break where the cable connects to the phone because it bends. But the last cable we just got delivered four days ago, worked until this morning when I started getting a non compatibility message as soon as I connect the cable. I also get the the charging sign on the iPhone, but it isn’t solid green. The battery flashes green, which I’ve never seen in any of the four models of iPhones I have had.This AmazonBasics cables are supposed to be Apple certified.

Pros: Seems like it won't fall apart easily and was the expected length. Charges fine and the phone doesn't complain it's not an official charger.Cons: It Won't. Stay. In. At all. If I so much as look at it the damn thing will come loose. The slightest movement and it will pop out, there's no chance to charge your device and use it at the same time. I'm pretty sure just receiving a message can pop it loose. And it's not my phone, my older chargers all still stay in just fine.

Since Feb 23, 2018, I have been using this charger daily, and since then, this charger has been through some very rough treatment.I am happy to say that it has survived over a year of harsh treatment, and it doesn't look like it plans to die anytime soon. I have been through several charger cables and have come across many issues in terms of compatibility and durability. Apple charger cables are NOT durable at all. Even when I treated them gently, they still found a way to break. When I use third party chargers, my phone complains about incompatibility.

RE-EDIT: Are you kidding me! This is my second time ordering this product, I bought the first one and it died within a month, then they sent me a second and it worked for a year, so I bought another and yet again it only lasted a month!! DO NOT BUY - they are so inconsistent.Edit: 4 star for customer service and longevity

This is my second or third USB cord purchase, always ordered the same one but never used in my MacBook Air USB port.  I plugged it in last week and immediately got an error message to unplug the device as it was using too much power.  Thinking it was due to the computer not being plugged into the power source, I reached down to grab the MacBook charger (Apple manufactured) when I noticed a burning smell.  The last thing I thought was the computer would be on fire, thought it was some neighbor burning their lunch.  After about a minute, I noticed my laptop was getting really warm on the side of the USB port.  I held it up to the AC to let it cool down, thinking it was just being used too long--again, it being on fire being the LAST thing on my mind.  It seemed to cool down but when I looked more closely, I saw orange sparks inside, finally realizing something had sparked in the USB port and the computer was literally going to melt.  I poured a tiny amount of water inside the USB port and it sizzled quiet as the sparks were put out.  Thankfully my computer still works!  The audio went out for a few hours but has since came back.  Scary to think what would have happened if I walked away while letting the devices charge.  USE EXTREME CAUTION WHEN USING THIS PRODUCT IN THE MACBOOK!!

—02/26/19- After nearly a year of gaming use (Asphalt8) the Amazon charge cord has not only survived it’s actually better. Originally the cord was relatively stiff & cumbersome but with use has become pliable & malleable. It’s actually improved with use.The above applies to all four purchased.  —-Original Review———-I ordered the amazon basics charge cords a year ago (old version) the outer insulation was split & cracked in under two weeks, terrible! This new version is vastly improved and has already proven to be much more durable. The cord itself is a little stiff at first but that’s the trade off for increased durability.

Update: Purchased July 2017. It’s now December 2017. I’m counting down the days until the cord snaps. It’s similar to the Apple chargers that kink and break where it inserts by the phone. Cheap enough that I’ll probsbly buy another, but wish it lasted longer. Super cute rose gold color to match my phone! I like that it's braided, so I hope it will hold up longer than my original iPhone one. Very happy with my purchase! Changing from 5 stars to 3 stars.

Who doesn’t need an extra charging cable? I’ve stuck with this brand, because they’ve been good to me.Let’s face it, most issues with USB/Lightning cables come from us abusing them—yanking, twisting, not paying attention while we’re trying to eat a sandwich, drive and cal our mother back. I don’t think there’s any one cable that will totally withstand our carelessness, but this guy does a good job.

Please please please, do not purchase this item. After three months of using this charging cable, my iphone shut off and wouldn't turn on. Apple ran a diagnostic that said my phone would never turn on again. Fortunately I had a backup phone that I used. Unfortunately - over the course of a month my second phone's battery was degrading rapidly. And then one day would never turn on. Apple ran the same diagnostic for the phone and told me the same thing - that it would never turn on again and that was in large part because the charging port was ruined (most likely by a faulty charger). My roommate used this charger and now her home button doesn't work. PLEASE DO NOT BUY - I had to buy myself a new phone I couldn't afford all because I didn't want to buy an expensive cable via Apple. It's better to just buy via Apple or your phone carrier because 1. this should never happen and 2. those are the only people who will help replace a phone they broke.

Charging cords can be very tricky to buy. In my experience, the least expensive tend to be poorly made. Thankfully this isn’t the case here. I don’t  know what my daughter does with charging cords, but they seem to break very quickly when she gets ahold of them. We’ve had this charging cord for a little while now, and is still holding up with no signs of it being poorly made (bending and fraying at the connection site).  So far, happy customer

Had this for several months and it started working less and less...  then I realized it started getting hot when it was charging.Last night when it was plugged in, the cord sparked right at the spot where it plugs into the phone and caught fire!
This charger barely charges. It charged my phone less than 5% in 15 minutes. My Bolse charger charges at least twice as fast. Don't waste your money on this one!

The cord worked great until about 6 weeks after purchasing it.  I plugged my phone in at night and in the morning the phone wasn't charged.  I checked the cord and sure enough the wires were visible where the cord meets the little piece that goes into the phone.  I'm very easy on my electronics and always carefully remove the cord by holding onto the plug part and not the cord.  I don't know why this happened but it was disappointing.

These worked well at first but after a couple of weeks devices started to disconnecting at random when plugged in and then about four weeks in, one tip got very hot (not connected to a device) and then stopped working. The second cable worked for a couple of additional weeks and then just stopped.  I’ve bought these before so this may be a batch issue, but would monitor them closely if you order them.
These are bad, everytime I get a knock off version, they always good bad, even if I take care of them, not sure why these companies make these and end up going bad quickly.Update: September 1, 2019

Ive had a lot of apple  charging cords , they end up not working or working ONLY in  certain positiions after a short timeI ordered one of these cords and it has kept working,  so I ordered another for convience(one in the wall, one attached to my computer, so I can back up my phone (imazing) and I might order one for my car....but i dont know cause my phone is so easy to charge, i have no issues with a plug for it...seems silly when I write this, but ive gone thru so many apple charging cords and THEY ARENT cheap  but this one  has worked great these last 6 months, I ve bought  2 as gifts.........

I purchased a 3 pack of these cables because I thought they'd be useful. I started using one about 2 weeks ago, and all of a sudden the adapter just falls out of my phone, won't stay in.  And at the very same time, the one I have in my car started doing the same thing.  It charges as long as you don't touch your phone, but falls right out if you move it.  These are as bad as the 3ft white cables that die after a couple months.  I would have expected Amazon Basics cables to be somewhat durable, but I guess I was wrong.  Should have just spent the money to buy the original Apple products.  Super irritating!!

When it comes to amazon basic products I probably buy iPhone cords the most. I finally just bit the bullet and bought the secure cord with the cover. I have had this product for several months and it is still like new. The length is amazing and is probably the best part. If you can go longer I would suggest that. I love the protective cover and it truly helps keep the inner cord safe. Also it works just as fast as an traditional apple iPhone cord that comes with the phone. The price can't be beat either!

This worked great for awhile, but has become one of those cords that requires jiggling and gets constant warnings about "unsupported accessories" whenever it's used. My iPhone 8 and my old 5s won't work with it at all and get only error messages. My son's 6s usually works eventually with the jiggling. He says he often gets the "unsupported accessory" message too, but somehow manages to get the phone to charge after a lot of finagling. Personally, I'd prefer to just plug in the phone and have it reliably charge rather than go through a whole process every time or, as has now happened twice, come back to a dead phone expecting a fully charged one, so I'm tossing this one and buying a different lightning cable.

This is a very good cable and I use it as my main charger for my phone. It is great because I no longer have to huddle near the wall as I had to with my older shorter chargers. Also being a wrapped cable it lasts longer than the rubber ones that you get from apple and that's why I prefer these. My only complaint is it doesn't work when syncing your phone. It kept disconnecting while both in my desktop and laptop. If you get this keep your apple cable for syncing and updates.

The difference between high quality cords and cheaper ones is not merely the thickness or resilience of the cord itself.  Since the purpose of these cords is to connect a device to a power source, the way the lightning end plugs in is really the most important issue as a weak or unstable connection won’t ensure charging.  I was very disappointed about the fit of the lightning connector with my iPhone 6e; it requires a lot of jostling to ensure the phone is charging and the connection is very suspect to movement (which announces itself with a dinging effect each time the leads touch and are broken).  In comparison, the comparably priced cords at big box stores don’t usually have this problem (yes, cheap ones will - cannot use them at all).  So I’m just disappointed at the mostly unusable nature of this cord which was intended for my car and yet has been relegated to my bedroom for long, fixed charging only.

Oh, the struggle to find a charger that actually works these days without paying an arm and a leg..I saw the positive reviews and I was like "hey, this looks great". I also saw some negative reviews and thought, "Amazon's a great company, I trust in their products so I'm going to take these negative reviews with a grain of salt and buy it anyway" (especially with that price tag).

I have had this charger for about less than a year. So far, it has been absolutely amazing. In my family I am known as the "charger destroyer" because high quality chargers like the Apple ones will only last 2 months max for me. BUT this charger has lasted quite a long time. Its material prevents it from getting stuck in things. It hardly ever gets tangled either. It chargers relatedly fast considering I got it longer than a regular. I don't think the wire will ever split or rip. Also amazing quality for its price. It didn't stop working like most lower-priced chargers do. 10/10 would recommend

This lightening cable is great. I have it for months now and is very useful in the car when sitting in the back and need long wire.Also when I am resting on the recliner it is long enough to reach the outlet.

For everyone who wants a durable cable that won't fray and tear at the usual places, this one is for you.  Built like a tank!.  The cable itself is thicker and stiffer that what you get in most cables, but you'd be hard pressed, I think, to tear these up by yanking them around as most people do with their cables. My wife goes through one every 3 weeks, but she has been using the same one now for 6 weeks, and it looks like it did on day 1 - so it looks as though she has finally found one she can't destroy.  Regarding cases on our iPhones, the lightning connector fits in with no problem.  With other cables I've had to trim out the connector hole in the case to make the connector head fit, but the head on this one is sleek enough that it fits just fine on both cases on our phones, without interference.

I thought the price was a little steep for a charging cable, but the quality is just fantastic it totally justifies the price.  the cable itself has a bit of a flex and stay property, so you can bend it in one position and it kinda stays like that, but not too strongly which is very nice.  the ends where the cables meet the USB/lightening adapters is the first place normal cables break, and these have very nice rubber supports which will definitely extend the life of this cable. also one nice thing that isn't mentioned is that the cable comes with a nice Velcro cable wrap so you can bundle it together for traveling.

I ordered this cord as I had lost the original IPhone charging cable.  I must admit that I have tried other cords that were inexpensive however they either didn't last or I was unable to use them.  After carefully searching online and reading reviews I decided to take a chance and order this charging cable.  It did not disappoint me.  I have had this cord for a few months and it has worked so well.  It charges quickly and I haven't had any difficulties with it.  I also love the longer length of the cord.  I would definitely purchase this product again and recommend it to friends.
I liked the material and the length but my phone started to reject my charger and other iPhones too it didn’t even last the month usually they last longer

I have had this cable for months now and it doesn’t break! It works perfectly fine even after long time. It is the best cable i have had, way better than the  original. Also it’s pretty too and is really long. I can’t believe I didn’t found this earlier in my life. I was always spending $10 or more for 10 cables from ebay and out of the 10 cables, 4 or 5 didn’t worked right out of the package and the others broke down really easily, even when I treated them carefully. Now i just have one cable, I was afraid to try it because I don’t want to spend $12 for just one cable and have it break down in a couple of weeks. But after reading the reviews I decided to try it. I am glad I did. If this one for some reason stops working I will still buy another one.

Don’t buy this cord. I purchased this cord 8 months ago and suddenly it just stopped working. I charge my iPhone over night and this morning I woke up thinking my phone was broken because it wouldn’t turn on. I tried other outlets, devices, and it still wouldn’t work. As another review said, it’s still in the condition I received it other than it looks like copper/metal on the actual charging piece has changed color in some places. I’m thinking the issue is that amazon is using a lower quality metal for the charging piece that wears out or in some other reviews catches fire. Not worth the risk for me and in future won’t be buying amazon branded products.

I always buy my cords from Amazon because they're cheaper by far than a box store.  I've tried a bunch of 'long' usb charging cables for my iPhone/iPad in the past and they are always hit or miss on whether the iPhone/iPad shows as charging.  Worse than that, they often charge half or a quarter as fast.  I looked specifically for Apple Certified on these and they actually work correctly and were about a 50% discount off the big box's cheapest cords of this length.

I’m sick of Apple and their high priced cords that don’t last long and is a way to gouge the customer even more. Here this brand is 1/3 the cost and has decent quality but the cord seems to perform the same as the apple cords that get that little discoloration on the tip that plugs into your phone, sort of like a burn mark or heat mark and then it doesn’t work as well or sometimes not at all without playing with the angle that it’s inserted into the phone.  The question ends up being should I buy these or go to the Apple store? Answer but these as you will get the same use and can buy 3 for the price of one!!!

Ever since we got our iphone 6s a few years ago, we've been buying and throwing away bad knock-off lightning cables.
