We had a family trip coming up last April and I came across Amazon Basics' cables and the price was not even a concern. I figured they'd work at least for the half-week trip and a bit more in the house.Not a single one of the 10-pack has broken since then and have given no signs of wear or inability to work. Granted, we still have 3 unused, but since 7 out of 7 have worked and worked well, I am definitely ready to recommend these to friends. Yes, this is a good buy.

I use this to charge my personal and company iphone. I don't move it around too much and it has lasted over a year. I personally think it's a better design than Apple's original cable that came with the iphone. Fits most of the iphones made in the last ten years. A great product!! Charges pretty fast when plugged into a usb plug into wall electric. Charging from a PC USB 3.0 port is pretty fast too (maybe 45 minutes to an hour, depends how drained your device is.

What happened here? I was influenced by great reviews, but it is a horrible product. It doesn’t seem to fit correctly in my devices. I have to position it just right to get it to charge. Even then, it comes and goes periodically. I’d go to sleep with 10% batter like, wake up with 24% instead of the usual 100. It’s not really made well. Very stiff, so it’s unwieldy. I can already see that it’s not going to last long. I bought two. Total waste of money. Major frustration.

I absolutely hated this product and I was not expecting to because I have never had any issues before with Amazon Basics product but this one was poorly made. I had a 6ft lightning cord before  that I had purchased from Target that was great but after about a year frayed too  much at the ends and had exposed wires. I decided to purchase a replacement from amazon because I had purchased other amazon basic products like hdmi cables and never had an issue and oh boy do I regret this purchase. The cord looks good and durable however the usb part does not fit snugly into the plug. The usb plug I have is an apple plug but the cord comes out basically any time I lift up the phone. I have even had it connected to my computer's usb port and the same thing happens, the usb part is just a tiny bit too small so the slightest nudge on the other end of the cable causes it to come out. Nothing worse then spending an hour charging your phone only to realize its now dead because it was never charging at all. Maybe mine was just a defect but rather than buying it online again I think I will just purchase from a store.

I’m currently waiting for my 3rd cable to arrive. The first cable started fraying around the lightening connection. The second cable started having a poor connection to my phone and would constantly become connected and disconnected. I really hope third time is a charm. If third time is not a charm I’m just going to have to return it for my money back and go with a different brand.

I purchased the Nylon braided lightning to USB 6 foot charging cable for my teenager who is rough on recharging cables.  So far this one seems to be withstanding the test of a teenager.  Nylon braiding adds additional protection for the cable and the cable charges must faster than standard USB charging cables.  The six foot charging cable length is also a nice bonus.

Quality control is decreasing. I’ve ordered dozens of these cables over the years. They’re starting to fail faster and faster. It’s not in the strength of the cable. The braid is great and the head connection to the cable is great which is where all others usually fail. These are starting to fail with the gold coating on the teeth. It’s getting worn off on certain teeth over time creating an awful connection.

Charges the phone like it's supposed to, quickly and with a long cord. The braid is thick and sturdy enough that it's not fraying or breaking despite a lot of use in a house with a rambunctious cat who thinks it's a snake to murder the hell out of. The only downside is that the nylon braiding is so thick that it doesn't roll up as neatly as a plastic-y cord, so it's best to have a cord tie around to manage it when it's not in use.
THIS MAYBE THE BEST IPHONE CHARGER EVER.It’s August 2019 and I purchased this charger in Oct 2016.
Well, my cat hasn't managed to get his teeth through it yet, so that's a plus. Length is good too.Doesn't charge my iPad as fast as other cables, but it does work though.

On the surface, this cable is of decent quality. The outer sheath is very nice and does not fray too easily, and it looks good. However... I soon ran into problems when I went to plug my phone in. The cable had lots of give and wiggle once it was plugged in. At first, this was fine. Then as I used it, the wiggle caused it not to sit properly and so my phone would not always charge. This next issue might have had to do with the wall adapter (although I was using an Apple adapter with an iPhone). While using this cable, even though my phone said charging the battery slowly decreased until it was eventually dead.Would I recommend this cable? Probably not but it seems to be luck of the draw judging from the generally high reviews. So go for it.

This is by far the best cable I have ever bought, Its soft and has held up well and works great.  I have purchased at least three for my self and the same or more for family members.  It’s the best cable on the market in my opinion.  Mine have lasted  as well..a long time far exceeding other cab;es in the past. One reason I believe it holds up so well is the longer ends and they are bendable and they are really well made.  Add to the beautiful color selection and you have the perfect cable.  Oh and do t forget the nice 6 foot length,but they do come longer too!  Can you tell I’m happy with these???

It seems like I have tons of devices that all need cords. All too often the included cord barely makes it to six months and many die before three months.However, this cord has been amazing. There has been no tearing at the plugs, the cord is just as sturdy as the day we received it, and the charging feature is just as solid.

I've been slowly switching out my regular Apple cords in favor of these braided cords because the Apple cords (either for the MacBook or iPhone) seem to fray and break near the joints. I was thrilled when I found that Amazon had started making braided replacement cords so bought it when my Apple cord broke. I've only used this product for a couple of months but I really like it so far. The length is really nice and the cord seems quite durable.

This cord is awesome. I've always had issue with the Apple cord and the other AmazonBasic Lightning cable fraying near the lightning connector. It might be a little pricey but it is well worth it. It feels well built and it does not kink easily. Once you purchase a longer cable, you won't be able to go back to the shorter ones since it is just so much more convenient. This cable even comes with a little Amazon velcro strap so you can neatly store your cable when not in use.

I bought this charger based on the reviews. I needed something long (6ft), would charge fast, and was durable. Now I can't speak to durability except to say the cord is VERY thin, but I can say it's an acceptable length. Where it leaves me sorely disappointed is in its charging (YOU HAD ONE JOB). I plugged in my ipad at 8:16 pm and checked it again at 9:16: it had only charged 30%. My other cables charged way faster. I may be able to use this for my phone but it's useless for an ipad. I would recommend investing in something better.

It took me at least 5 Apple charging cables falling apart at the connector before I realized I didn't have to live this kind of life.  I would plug one in every night and wonder if this is the night the exposed wiring would betray me.  I think I spent more money on black electrical tape to hold the thing together than any of them were worth...I've now owned two of these braided cables for the past year and they still look brand new after every day use.  I've rolled them up, tossed them into bags and have taken them everywhere I go.  The 6ft length is perfect and now I can virtually walk around anywhere in my house with my phone charging...  and by anywhere, I mean the important areas:  the bed, the couch and the toilet.

So far I have had little to no issues with this charger (other than its length). However, it being shorter than I wanted is on me. It works very well for what it is, and strikes me as quite sturdy. Unfortunately it will easily get unplugged if you aren’t careful with it due to it being short. Overall I would highly recommend this charger if you need to get a charger for an iPhone, dare I say it’s better than the official Apple chargers.

I’ve had this for more than a year and I’m very surprise how long it had lasted as I usually go through apple’s cords constantly. The wire is braided so you can trust the charging area won’t split open as the apple ones tend to do after several use. Really happy with these, I’ve bought a few more for my family members as well, all different colors which is easier to associate who wires are who. Definitely a well-made product!

This lightning cable seems to do the job but after receiving it and reading other reviews, I’d steer clear.  Even if a small overall fraction of reviews indicate catastrophic failure, it’s too many for me.  Look around and you’re bound to find quality lightning cables that don’t have a tendency to melt or, even worse, burn up.  There may be more to those stories but for me, I’m a bit freaked out using this one.  I should have read more reviews before ordering.  Live and learn...

This charger is super durable and great quality. Amazon chargers are actually all I use now. My Apple chargers fall apart so quickly with how much I use them and take them with me. The amazon ones hold up extremely well. They are able to take on being in a purse, work bag and backpack - rolled up and unrolled. I’ll only be buying these chargers moving forward. Your money is actually well spent when you buy these.

This was working fine as advertised (i.e. MFi certified) but just after the 1 year warranty period, it stopped working all together.  No messages pop up, no warning, and no charge.  It consides with iOS 12.01 upgrade on iPhone 7.When I contacted Amazon (since this is Amazon basic brand), I was told that they will not do anything nor even offer replacement since it's been more than 1 year.  I paid extra to get the Amazon brand for the expected (?) quality but this turned out to be no better than the cheaper Chinese brand.

BEST FREAKING CHARGER I HAVE EVER OWNED. I came back to say I purchased this in 2017 and it is now 2020. I am still using the same charger. I will buy this for the rest of my life because of how durable it is. All of my apple chargers have never lasted as long as this has. Please continue to make this!

These cables are pretty decent overall. My two teenagers, for some reason for which they refuse to acknowledge and accept any responsibility (shocker...), tend to break their charging cables within a matter of months (funny cause mine always seem to do just fine...). So far these cables still seem to be working beyond any cables previously purchased.

This is my 2nd Amazon Basics charger for my iPhone 6s and it works great. It's a great snug fit just as the original Apple charger and my phone recognizes it immediately, no delay. I bought the first one over a year ago and still works just as good as it did day one. I love the gray color and the nylon braiding. My original Apple charger has frayed towards the tip, most of the wires have severed, it's still charging but doesn't look safe and it probably won't last long. Not sure how as its the one that stays in the car and doesn't go through as much abuse as the in-home, but the nylon braiding seems more durable. I have no doubt it will withstand the life of my iPhone.

This charger is complete garbage. It broke off INSIDE my iPad. After several different attempts by several different people, it was able to be removed; however, it damaged the connectors and now my iPad is unable to be charged. So, I highly recommend buying official Apple products and not skimping for cheaper options. This product destroyed my iPad and cost me several hundred dollars in repair attempts and eventually the purchase of a new iPad.

I am a big believer in Apple products and tend to only buy my iPhone and iPad accessories from them directly, nothing third party. But lately the cords from Apple are starting to fray and fall apart - they still work fine- they just definitely need a design upgrade. Steve Jobs would be so disappointed!These cords from Amazon are a really great quality product. They hold up well, charge just as good and fast as the Apple cords, and they are super durable and don't fray like the plastic/rubber coated ones.

I bought these for my brother since his iPhone charger cord was bent and the wire exposed. Still that boy was trying to use that fire hazard death trap. I got him these since the wire is covered by a braid and I like that it’s very bendable. If that makes sense. It’s like a string so I’m less worried about it wearing quick and another exposed wire. This particular cord is long so it’s a perfect length so he doesn’t have to have his extension cord right on his bed.I even bought me the pink shorter version of them.

This cord is a very nice alternative to the basic Apple charging cable.  It is more durable than the Apple cords.  It does work with my Apple products with no issues!  The only drawback is that the size is a bit short and I wish I had chosen the longer cord.  I will definitely order a second cord because of the need for longer size.  However, the gold color is very pretty and neutral.  It charges everything very quickly.  I have had zero issues!

I love this nylon braided USB if you have an Apple product you know that buying cords are very difficult because half of them the apple does not recognize. But this cord Not only do I use it for my iPad Pro without any problems I also use it for my iPhone and then my daughter borrowed mine and use it for her iPhone. I can see now I’m going to need to get at least three more cords. This was well worth every penny.

I like the braided cord. It does not fray near the lightning connection like the apple cords do. I used the 3 foot one in my truck and it did the job. The contacts on the lightning end did eventually wear out - tried cleaning it with alcohol and plugging in several devices, but none of them could make a good connection. Aside from it wearing out, it was a very good product for almost three years.

Appears to be a very well made chord . I was impressed with it so much I actually ordered another one the day this one arrived. If anything pops up to change my mind on this review then I will make a follow up post . Update, with very limited use by July 4th weekend the chord quit working and now it is a nightmare to get any thing done with it

These are great chargers. We have tried several other brands that quit working, but we have three of these and two have been working for at least a year (i don’t remember when we bought them). The longer cord comes in handy when laying in bed or whenever you need to use the phone and charge at the same time. Highly recommend.

If your household is anything like mine then you go through charging phone like crazy...between the various iphones, and ipad our family owns and my 8 year old daughter using them....the cords NEVER last long...however this cord has lasted the longer of any in quite awhile. It has great protection and strength at the cord tips and doesn't get all bent like the cheap ones like this do.Purchasing Apple certified things definitely makes a difference, they do last longer!!

The amazon basics cables are so much better then the charging cables that come provided with the phones. Nice quality cables that are very durable, and don’t fail at either end of the cord. The colors are nice and bright. Very easy to use. Use just like every other charging cord you’ve used before.

This cord is very durable and seems like it will hold up for a few years. Unlike many people, I’m very gentle on my charging cords but still, the flimsy ones break after about a year. I have no doubt that I will get 2-3 years out of this cord, likely even more. No regrets at all with this purchase.

What I love most is the material this is made from. My car loves to chew cords and she got through the stock IPhone cable like butter. This one is much more durable and honestly I think she gave up haha.I also love the length! I use this in my room and the outlets are behind my bed and kind of awkward so my old cord barely reached the top of my bedside table. Plus it’s pink! ❤️

When I found myself in need of a new charger for my iPhone I of course went to Amazon. I found this Amazon basic charger in gold, which matches my phone color, and I thought OK that’s a good price that’ll do. Little did I know when I got it in, that this was the best, most beautiful, best bargain that I have gotten this year! The color and the materials are sturdy, it has this cute little wrap around it to keep it from getting punched up, and it fits my phone perfectly. Well done Amazon!

While it worked, I loved it - charged quickly, nice cord (matched my phone :) ), good length. However, it stopped working about 10 months after I got it. I didn't move it around much - I had it plugged in in my bedroom most of that time. I took it in the car a few times, but that's it. I know charging cables stop working after a time, but this was faster than I expected for a braided cord. :(

This is the product that made me believe in Amazon Basics. Forreal. I bought this item 3x. I had one as a travel and one as a home use, and who can deny a long charger cord? Mom needed on, gave her my extra. My cousin needed one and never gave it back so I had to buy another one. I’ve had it for about a year, never any issues. I love that there’s a small velcro strap that wraps up the cord. I love it.

I have no complaints. I got the 6ft cord and I absolutely love the length. I also really like the rose gold color. The charger works well, I haven’t gotten any “this accessory isn’t supported” pop ups. I saw some reviews of the charger catching on fire which concerned me, but I haven’t had that problem. I will say that I’ve noticed that my apple wall cube and my iphone both get very warm while I’m using the charger but that’s the extent of it. I’m overall very happy with this charger.UPDATE: I bought this charger on June 2nd, 2018. At the time of updating this, its May 11th, 2020. My charger finally stopped working today after just about 2 years. I’m super satisfied with the length of life for this charger. I ordered another two about six months ago and haven’t had any problems with those either. No burning, no fires, no “accessory not supported” nonsense. I think these are a great deal.

These are a vast improvement on the garbage, horribly flawed cables Apple provides, but they still wear out after maybe a couple years of normal use. We've had a couple were the metal pin connectors get scraped away and the phone no longer recognizes it reliably. The actual cable holds up very well do to the braiding.

I really liked this cable and used it daily until today when it began to charge erratically and suddenly started to smolder and burn at the phone plug end.  Apparently the small wires inside the braid broke from flexion.  This was a frightening event as I was using it at the time.  Am glad it did not happen while charging in the middle of the night when it might have gone unnoticed until it caused a fire.  Purchased 5/10/18.  Used daily until 4/1/19.To be fair, it got a lot of use and a lot of bending at the point it failed.  Be careful to check cables and throw them out at the first sign of broken wires - though the intermittent charging was the first sign of a problem as the braided cover did not show damage.  I will give this three stars because I did get good use out of it over several months.

I’m updating my review bc im seeing a lot of bad reviews. To each their own but I personally don’t believe the negative reviews. I’ve always used this charger. When I had the iPhone 5 is when I discovered the “accesory not supported crap” and realized it messed the phone up. Since then, through my 6, 7, and 8, it’s been the only charger I even use anymore and never had a single issue. The ONLY apple approved product to buy. Favorite! The price is great so you should at least give it a try.

I cannot recommend this product.I use several of the white/black AmazonBasics charging cords. Since my wife and kids tend to borrow cords I thought I'd get this one as it would be readily identifiable.

So I bought this in August 2017, it has been used daily for over 2 years. This is definitely worth the money. The cord is still in great condition despite daily abuse but it doesn’t charge consistently anymore. I think I definitely got my money’s worth. Great buy I highly recommend. I am ordering the newer model now and I hope it’s as good.
If you travel a lot you go through lots of cables.They all seem to wear out around the connector.
The cable itself is well made and robust. It's the contact points on the lightning end of the cable that wear out far too quickly. Had 3 cables that have done this so far.

It was great until the little piece that goes inside my phone completely dislodged from the charging cable. Thank god I was able to get it out from my phone but now my phone doesn’t even hold a full charge because of the damage. Very sad and disappointing, I didn’t even have it for 2 months and I’ve never used it outside my one outlet in my bedroom.

I’ve had 3 of these ... wife has one in the room next to bed it’s still like new uses it nightly... I had one for work in my big rig and used it daily for about 13 months before the tip got warn and wouldn’t charge consistently so I just purchase a new one I expect it to last long time they are nicer then any other you find .... well except a monster audio one but those are $45

My wife got some cheaper braided lightning cables that had 3 in a pack and in a week, 1 was broken, the other was shorting out and only one was still reliable. I bought these shortly after she had hers and I think these are the best Lightning cords to buy. The reinforcement at the base of the connections make it almost impossible to kink unless you were trying hard to do so. The velcro string is a very good feature to keep it organized esp if you don't need the full length of the cord. Well worth the money. Now my wife has asked me to get her 2 of these. I will probably get myself another one for the office.

I use this cord for my battery pack, which gets thrown in my bag and suffers quite a bit of contortions. This has outlived every other battery pack cord I've bought, regardless of size or brand name. The braiding makes it resistant to damage from bending, and the charge is super fast. Can't recommend enough!

Honestly, I’ve had this cord for many months now and never had an issue! Where, by now, the traditional Apple cord would’ve been in pieces, this cord held through traveling to India, and back, being crumpled into small places, bending, and so much more that I would not even dare do to the Apple version without it splitting. This was so durable! It’s also a gorgeous pink to boot. Length is lovely. And it has a bendy quality that I like. I use it all the time everywhere... I had to get another one!

Thank you AMAZON! Excellent quality and I love the fun colors. I got rose and it is a very light, soft pink. The attached velcro strap is very helpful and convenient for traveling with it. So far, I have used my cord with both iPhone 8 & 6 with no issues and I use it mostly with this charger: 45W Mini Charger for MacBook Air 11 inch 13 inch Magnetic 2 T-tip Apple MAC Power Charger Adapter https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S4TLYH/

I bought a 10 pack of these and so far 2 don’t work at all. Phone doesn’t even register the cable. Not a good thing when one of those non-working cables is what you brought with you on a transcontinental flight for a two week trip... it was definitely the cable as I was able to borrow a spare cable from a seat mate that worked fine.  Now paying airport prices for a replacement cable to get me through the rest of the trip.

Pros: Great cord length; cord is durable and has not broken/ripped in the 2 years I've had it.Cons: For the last year, they do not properly charge my phone (slow charge, or not at all). It's the piece that goes into the port that goes faulty. All 3 of these chargers have now had this issue.

Awesome design is only one of the great aspects of this product. The durability is admirable and the cord quality is splendid!! As soon as I unpacked it, I accidentally dropped and stepped on the charger part, yet it did not even acquire the slightest scratch. The material is so sturdy I am confident I can use this for years. The non-twisting feature heightens the product's greatness in that the shape stays as I want! Overall, AWESOME!!

I am not sure why so many negative reviews are the top hits on here, but I have had four of these cables for several years with absolutely no problems. They are sturdy and give extra length for movement vs the original cables. Now, I only use the official Apple chargers that came with my iPhones and iPads, not aftermarket ones. Perhaps that may be an issue with the negative reviews.

I have 3 of these cords and love them! I have a business in 2 different locations and my phone battery sucks, I used my phone for music and have a clock open when I work. These are great cords, and I love the color. The outside is a durable braided material. It comes with a small velcro attachment to wrap it up when you travel. The USB is standard. Great length I love this product!

I love this chord because it’s durable and is much like a rope so I don’t have to worry about the plastic splitting. The only downside is that the piece that goes into the phone is slightly larger so I have to take my phone case off whenever I charge it. Otherwise really great product. I recently ordered another.

I purchased these from amazon about one week ago. Amazon sent me a time sensitive link to review them before the wires inevitably stopped functioning. I have only opened a few of the 10 wires and they work fine, as all wires do when they’re new. Can not speak to their durability, quality, or use for traveling. They come with a convenient Velcro wrap as not to tangle. Hopefully I just made $3. I will try to update in time.

I was a little concerned because so many of these cords have mixed reviews, and decided to go with an AmazonBasics selection because they've usually been reliable.  I'm very pleased that I did.  I've had this for more than a month, and it worked right out of the box, and is durable and long enough that I can still use it, even texting and playing games, while it's plugged in and charging.  So far, so good.  Thanks, Amazon.

Those 54 thousand or so reviewers are telling the truth guys!If you’ve used Apple charging cables, you know how they tear after a few months of use. Once we started using this Amazon Basics line, we replaced every single cable with these.

I got this charger 9 months ago , and about a month ago it already started to have issues charging. The material didn’t fall apart externally as far as exposed wires but must be something wrong internally or the usb piece that goes into the phone port. The length of the chord was super handy otherwise and I’ve asked customer service to either replace or refund as it is under warranty for a year ...

Like I said in the title, this cable is sturdy, and well made. The cable provided by Apple is expensive but is of poor quality. I have been an Apple user for many years since the Mac SE, but some of their products are under-built and over-priced. The length is adequate to reach the outlet from my desk.

We have a lot of Apple devices in our house and go through a lot of lightning cables.  This one is without a doubt the best premium cable we've found.  These are durable, charge fast, feel nice/high quality, and are priced very competitively.  There are cheaper cables, but they miss on the aforementioned points.  However, if you are comparing other premium lightning cables, these are as good as we've found.

I purchased two cords. One pink, one silver. Love the idea of a long cord. I have an outlet in the floor of my family.  6’ cords, just aren’t long enough.Sadly, as the other comments related, the cord separates from the plug pretty quickly.

Recently upgraded from an iPhone 5 to an 8 and x. Previously purchased an aftermarket off brand lightning cable to use with the iPhone 5 that didn’t work perfectly and caused some issues when plugged in and when in use, but still charged the 5. Old cable didn’t work with the iPhone 8 and x. This amazonbasics one works perfectly with no compatibility issues when plugged in and using the phones. Would definitely purchase again.

Sick of replacing your iphone-brand or off-brand charging cord?  Buy this. Near impossible to kink, especially near the ends, which receive the most wear and tear. Had these for 18 months and never had to replace one because it broke.  The only problem:  can’t  seem to keep my hands on them.  They work so well that people”accidently” take them, i lose them during business travel, or my daughter amasses them at school and,. If asked, gives them away.  There are worse problems in the world to track and fix—take replacing your charger off the list.

I purchased this cord back in June 12, 2018 and it already broke, last month to be exact, the thing that is so weird about this cord is that it looks brand new on the outside!! but very disappointing that it doesn't work anymore. I really take care and handle my things with care, that 's why they usually last me for a long time, not this one. I guess you get what you paid for, 1 year or less for a good priced cord.

Got 2 of these and they worked right out of the box on my ipad pro and iphone 7+. Build quality is good especially at the point where the cable ends meets the connector. Feels like even if sustain lots of yanking/bending the outer cable shielding won't get torn off. During insert of connector into ipad/iphone, there is a little resistance and then it 'clicks' into place just like the real Apple lightning cable. The connection is solid and doesn't wiggle. If you try to slowly pull the cable out the ipad or iphone gets pulled along with it!

This is actually my third time buying this cord. It's so good the first one was stolen. The second one shorted out after like two years.  Keep in mind that's two years of hard and often inappropriate use. I constantly use my phone while it's charging. I unplug it by pulling it by the cord instead of the base. And It's my only cord so it does a lot of traveling and spends a good amount of time tangled at the bottom of my bag or shoved in the. Yet and still she stands strong! Best charger since my original iPhone charger wore out after only a couple of months.

This product is really just like any other charger.  Not very durable, does the trick, but needs replacing every couple of months.  I bought five to use in a business capacity, daily, and with multiple people using it.  Wear and tear are bound to happen, but I did expect more than the usual with the nylon braided cord.  I would buy again, for the price, but don't expect anything extaordinary.

This just stopped working all of a sudden. I’ve had it for a year and a half and it had been working great but now it is just a useless string. This has been my bedside cord, so no rough use, no traveling, no damage at all. Disappointed

Love this cord! It is very sturdy and no fraying at the connection sites.  It is a little pricier than some out there but this cord should last me a long time instead of only a month like so many of the cheap ones.  I bought me a silver one first months ago and have had no problems and use it at work daily.  The pretty pink one I have had for a month  and keep it at home and use it every night.  I highly recommend these over the cheaper ones because you will just have to replace them in less than a month usually so not worth it.

I have been having this charger for over a year now and it is still holding up pretty good. Unlike the Apple chargers, this charger does not get flimsy due to the type of cord that it is made out of. The colors to choose from make it very trendy. I love the length of this also, as I can plug it in on one side of my king-size bed and it reach almost all the way to the other. If this one goes out I would definitely purchase another one.

While it worked, it worked great, and that was for about less than 2 months. After that time my phone wouldn’t charge unless I’d plug in a certain way. Fine. So I dealt with that for 2 month with the occasional “this accessory isn’t supported” prompt.Last night I’m charging my phone and I hear a crackling and I see smoke! I pull it out and the cable is singed. I used an actual Apple USB-C to Lightning Cable after that and it charged fine so I know it’s not my phone. I think the burning could’ve come from the fact the wall outlet was too strong but I checked online and it seems to give the same output as a regular Apple charger. I’m buying an actual Lightning to USB Cable from Apple now (from the actual Apple site); despite the price it’s not worth the risk of destroying your phone.

i've had my first charger for at least 2 and a half years. I purchased my second to have in another room and it's the same quality as the one i bought years before. I haven't had any issues with charging and the cord has stayed intact (no separation at the base near where it plugs into  your phone). for sure my fav charger and prefer it over apple's brand for sure.

These used to be my favorite chargers. Much more durable than the Apple ones that fray all the time. But the quality of these has gone downhill. Now I go through them like candy. I thought I was doing something wrong or accidentally getting them wet somehow, but  based on the reviews, looks like other people have lots of issues with them as well.
I've had this cable less than a month but I'm very happy with it so far.It's definitely a sturdy cable and it works great.

This set lasted me only about three months before it stopped charging my devices.  Started out giving me the message that the item was not supported and got stranger from there.  Is fine if you only need it for a few days but it just didn’t last and 2as a waste of money.  I have found other brands that actually last.

The cable itself is built very well, it feels very rigid, and the lightning connector seems to hold up nicely.However, the biggest problem with this cord is that it lasted me for just under three months of usage. The entire point of having a charging cable is to functionally charge your devices, not to admire it for its sturdy build. If I can’t charge it, then it’s serves absolutely no purpose.

Love this rose colored IPhone charging cord. Is thicker & seems more durable than regular thin plastic cords, but alas worked great for 4 mos then just pooped out. I contacted Amazon for a replacement and quickly received new one in 2 days. Impressive, now let’s see if product stays impressive. Thanks Amazon. This is exactly why I prefer to shop Amazon; impeccable customer service (and product unbeatable cost).Debi McDonald

I don't give these a 5 star mainly due to Apple not Amazon. The Lightning adapter tip is problematic with all cables I have used. Eventually they get bent or loose and stop working reliably. I would buy these over others and really like them. Amazon stands behind them but even then the issue will always be with the tip and its design. I wish Apple would switch to USB C but then "they would be like everybody else."

I brought this charging cable because of it's long length, it had a good rating, and it's from Amazon. Amazon products are very good in quality overall. It was absolutely great at first. Fast charging, the long length, and material of the good - everything was great.A little after 2 weeks of use the charging became exponentially slow. For an example, I'd leave it on charge for a good hour without using my phone and the battery of my phone would increase to 2% or 3%. It came to the point where if I were to use my phone while charging, my battery would decrease instead of increase (I saw the numbers dropping with my own eyes).

Can’t be 100% sure but I think this cable ruined my battery. Shortly after I started using it my battery began to drain during the day super fast. Maximum capacity (found in battery health) went from 100% to 91% in about 2 months. I spoke with Apple support and tried several things to try and fix it (deleting apps, resetting network settings, ect) to no avail. I’m going to an Apple store this weekend to have the battery replaced. If it turns out the cord wasn’t the issue I’ll come back and update my review.

I keep this as an extra cable to carry with me. I wrap it around my charger and it's very easy to untangle and doesn't get caught often. It's also a very durable item and I've had it for a while now and it's barely damaged! It also charges well and has not given me any issues (i.e. Apple does not support this accessory). Overall, a good buy! Length is not too long, but it's just preference at that point.

I wanted to love these cords. I’ve had amazon basics cords in the past and they worked fine but the last couple have not. I don’t know if this is a change on Apple end or Amazon. I decided to try the braided cord due to the good reviews but unfortunately I experienced the same issues as several other 1 star reviews. The cord worked great for a couple weeks, then intermittent charging, then nothing. I expect a cord to last longer than 3-4 weeks.

Connectors still fowl up after a few months Just like the genuine iPhone cables. These are built better. Yet if connectors on all cables keep fowling and oxidising or whatever, then it's a mute point for any cable wether oem or Amazon top. This hinders charging as connection is not always met. I have installed brand new lightening receiver in the iPhone as well.... so....??? All Apple lightning cables oem and generic are bound to fail after a few months. Has happened on numerous lightening cable devices iband others have owned.

I liked the cord for just about a month… Then it began not making a connection tight. I could no longer send it back. If I plug in my phone and leave it sitting and don’t touch it sometimes it charges  but if I pick it up the dinging starts, Which would mean it is not making a good connection I don’t think this cord is a good value keep looking.

READ THIS.After years of being an apple customer, I have found that the only company that makes good cords for Apple products is Amazon Basics. Even Apple falls short when it comes to cords. The Amazon Basics cords last forever and I’ve only been buying them ever since I ordered my first one. The only reason I’ve ever needed to order a new one is if I lose it, not because of breaking or damage. These are seriously the best, especially the nylon braided ones. Don’t get the plastic/rubber ones, get these.

Very sturdy feeling and durable. It is shorter than I expected (I ordered the 3 ft cable which is the same length as the Apple one I have) but it does it’s job and it’s very sleek looking! Will recommend to anyone seeing this review (:*update* so it’s now March of 2019 and I still use this charger!! No tears, no hassle to get it to work; nothing! This literally could never have been said about all the authentic iPhone chargers that you get with your iPhone and those are $29! So if you want a seriously great and long lasting charger that can handle anything, I highly endorse this!

The first of these charging cords that I ordered managed to fry itself in a few days, so I returned it, got a new one, and assumed that I just so happened to get a botched one.  However, the replacement cord has not fared much better.  After only a couple of months it broke such that it would only charge my phone if inserted with a particular side up (and wouldn't work on the other side), and now, less than 6 months later, it's doing the thing where it will only charge the phone if the cord itself is in a very specific position; heaven forbid you bump it even a little.Overall, I do not recommend this charging cord at all.  Buy yourself something better that will actually last.

I’ve had several Amazon Basics cables and they’ve worked great, but eventually they start breaking apart. When I saw this braided one I thought I would be purchasing a reliable and durable cable... well I purchased two and straight from the package neither one charged, never worked.  Complete garbage.

Usually I would not spend this much for a non-Apple charger because they always stop working.  The overall reviews were positive for the product so I took the chance.  About a month after use, it stopped charging my devices just like all of these non-Apple chargers eventually do.  When it did work, it worked very well and I was extremely pleased.  My suggestion is go to the dollar store and get a charger because at least you won't spend so much on a defective charger. Don't waste your money on this.

This cable has really held up from all the abuse that my 9 year old puts it through. I've never had the "Incompatible accessory" popup on her phone. Charging is as fast as the regular apple cable and the material of this cable is extremely durable and shows no signs of wear or unraveling. It's a great price especially compared to the official Apple branded ones. Highly recommended. Hope this was helpful!

I have owned this charging cord for almost two years to the day. Purchased on 3/9/18. This is the best cord I have ever owned. Has gone thru 3 phones with me. Still charges like the day I got it in the mail. There is a little wear and tear on it. The cord cover is a fuzzy looking and the rubber end by the metal part is torn but still attached. It still charges with no problems. The internal wires are still protected. I take this cord with me everywhere. Daily it is rolled up and put in my purse. Since the wires are so protected it has no shorts even from this daily routine. I highly recommend this cord.
This attractive cord works well.  When my phone wouldn't charge,  I replaced the cord and it still would not work.  It wasn't the cord.  The phone had lint packed into the port.

Absolutely adorable color, also making it easy to tell it apart from our many other charging cords. I got a fairly long length, hoping to be lazy and stay in bed charging my phone half way across the room. I should have bought the longest length they had for my purposes, but I can still make it work.Quality of the cord is nice. Much harder for my cat to gnaw on. Was happy to replace my fraying cord that was becoming a hazard 😬

Much better quality than the apple charging cables that tend to break at their base. I first purchased one for myself because it was cheaper than the apple ones and I did not have to drive to a store and look for parking. Then I purchased (I think) more than dozen of all colors and lengths for our family of 4 with many devices because they work great.Revised review after 2 years of purchase: about half of our purchase is now in trash, stopped working. I’m now again buying the overpriced Apple chargers and cords because they’re always very reliable.
Has these cords for 2 years. They worked fine until one day one just stopped charging. I suppose I got my money's worth out of them. The length on them is great.

Bought this in 11/25. On 2/15 it started acting up and not charging my iPhone 11 properly. It goes in and out. It charges for 1-5 secs then stops then starts again. So annoying. It does still charge my iPad Pro (1st gen). I only plug it in by my bed and it’s never shuffled around. No kids or pets bother it. It just stopped working correctly suddenly. Disappointed.

I have 3 of these and they work very well.  I bought the 3 foot for the car but also own 2 of the 6' ones which are a life changer.  No need to sit on top of the outlet with an inch of arm room.  I've had them for months with no sign of wear and tear or fraying at the plug ends like the white cords that come from apple.  And they're a pretty shimmery color.  Love these!

I got this for my sisters bf when I ended up getting him as my Secret Santa. He had been saying he needed a charger for his car so I ordered the shortest one they had. He loved it! He said it works perfectly and that he loves the cord because it matches the inside of his car. Worked out great.

I bought one and it overheats and my iPad would charge and not charge every few seconds. Amazon replaced it and the second one does the same. I know it is not the cube or the iPad because I tried it on a different device with the same results. Can not leave plugged in without supervision because it seems it could be a fire hazard. Just bought another one from a different seller.

I am one of those who buys a new charger every three months but this one has lasted me and it seems like it will last me some good years. The lenght is perfect, lets me roll in bed comfortably while charging my device. The charging power is also good, chargers pretty fast compared to cheap gas station chargers. Good value for what you get.

Honestly, I expected this cable to work just fine from the quality when I opened my mail. Nope. Did not work on my first, second, nor fifth attempt. I tried plugging it into my laptop, a wall charger, a portable charger, a car charger, NOTHING. It worked for a sec the following day so I decided to give it a chance, but when I looked back at my phone it had not charged. It actually went from 60% to 50% because I was playing music from my phone. Unbelievable. I took out my frayed cable that I was trying to replace with these and THAT worked better. Maybe I was sent a malfunctioning dud, but I would still not recommend this cable.

Have previously bought the cheap Amazon Basic chargers and had no issues until they developed the inevitable "Turtleneck of Death". Decided to try these based on reviews. Have had less than a week and I regret it.Order two (Grey and Gold), and both have started making the "GUNG" noise anytime the phones (a 7 and XR) thinks it's been moved or is moved. Have checked with other chargers and had no issue. These are basically garbage. The build would make you think they're durable, but looks are deceiving.

The end of this charger is thicker/bulkier than a real iPhone charger. So if you have a case like mine that fits an apple charger, but barely fits one of these bulkier amazon chargers, you have to force the Amazon charger through the case opening to get this to pass through. After doing that enough times (about 4 or 5 months), this is the ONLY charger that will work for my phone now. And it has to be positioned exactly right, or the phone won’t charge. The charging port on my phone is now ruined from using this bulkier charger.Tried to save a few bucks, trusted amazon, now I need a new phone. Spend the extra money on a real iPhone charger is my advice.
So far I'm loving Amazon's version best. I'm tired of hunting for a GOOD QUALITY nylon braided charging cord and this is just right.

Looks good and works well. What I don't like it that the cord is one of those braided stiff cords. I have other cords that are also braided and soft and last quite long.The stiff charging cords wires will kink and be more apt to break or fray inside the sheath and you'll never know it (upon visual inspection). But thought I'd try it since I like most Amazon products.

Since this is an Apple Certified product, the disclaimer message no longer appears on my screen when using another brand of USB cable.  It is sturdy and it charges quickly...very impressed with the speed of it!  Easy to plug in and stays secure in the ports.  I use it at my work desk and the 3 feet is perfect.  I've not had any issues with this cable.  Rose gold color is very pretty and the Velcro piece to roll up the cord is nice to have although it does detach sometimes.  It's easy to get it back onto the cord and use again.  I  love it and will be purchasing another one for home but most likely in the 6 feet range. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  Great price, too.

Aside from being the perfect length, my favorite thing about this cord is that you can bend it to any shape you want. It makes traveling a lot easier, because you can wrap it into a tidy shape, and it's easy to find in a bag.  It also doesn't get all torn and ratted at the ends, so I've been able to use it for a long time.

I have had this charger for almost a year now, and it still works perfectly! I haven't had any breakage or ripping. All my other apple chargers broke so fast, but this one is still going! I also love how long it is. I don't have to sit right next to the outlet anymore. I recommend this charger if you're a little bit rough with your chargers.

This is a nylon braided USB to lightening cord that is silver in color.  As advertised, the cable is very strong and has exceeded my expectations as it relates to the life of these types of cables.  This is not my first braided cable; however, this is the first one that has NOT come unraveled at the connection points.  Because it has lasted my constant bending at least for over a month (my cables are usually destroyed by then), I have ordered three of these and have not been disappointed.

I don’t want to comment on durability until I have had this longer. I can say it is not as heavy duty or as flexible as the previous one that I ordered in pink. I understood they were the same cord. This one is thinner. The other one lasted exactly 1 year, within 2 days of my order.

I’ve had it for a month, and it worked great charging my iPad and iPhone X. The end peice didn’t start wiggling from taking it out of the electronics often like the other ones I’ve bought. Bad thing though is that the plug did break off in my iPad when it fell off the bed. Had to take it out with a pair of pliers. Overall I would buy it again.

Perfect length for everyday carry, and the braided cable is proving to be durable and does not want to tangle easily. Allows full charging and data capability, unlike some cheap aftermarket cables. Overall a great cable for the money, and is much higher quality as opposed to other cables in its price bracket.

I should have never bought this. The color and length were great, but like others have said, it occasionally gets overheated and makes me worry that it’s going to start a fire. Then most times it is plugged into my phone, I can’t get into my phone. I have to hard-restart the phone to get the screen to come back on. I’ll be calling Amazon to complain about this one.

These are my favorite chargers!!!  I have one for all my devices.  They charge great, last forever (I haven’t replaced my original one from 4 years ago), extra long cord is great!  I have a cat that chews through cords, and he can’t ruin these!  The Velcro attached to it makes it super easy to wrap them up for travel!

I purchased two of these cables as replacements for the ones from Apple, and I have had them now for well over a year.  These things are indestructible.  I will be buying more of these if I ever need.  They survive cat bites, and all the basic wear and tear that these cables are usually subjected too.

Bought this for my husband since he wanted longer cable for his phone while he on his computer. We did had the ikea extra USB port but he wasn’t found of the weird annoying noise that’s coming out of the USB port.Ever since he got this amazon basic lightning cable, he has no issue.

It’s more durable because the material. The connection part hasn’t had any sign of broken. I have bought enormous apple cables from many places with vary prices from $6-$40+ and this one is by far the one has the best quality. Highly recommend.

I bought this in 2017 and started using it around late 2017. It is now Feb2020 and this charger is still going strong! The braid where the wires usually break and get exposed are very well made. The charging power is great - you can't spot the difference between this and the original. Since I still haven't had any issues with the compatibility, it's safe to assume that it's most certainly MFI certified. I'm usually more of an advocate for the original Apple products to use with Apple devices, but I would 100% recommend these to anyone and everyone over the original!

This cord worked for less than a month, then out of no where I get a “This accessory is not compatible with your iPhone” notice and it’s no longer working. I tried it with two other charging blocks, in case that was the problem, and also with my iPad. Same notice comes up everywhere. So now it’s trash to me.

Heavy duty braided cord last so much longer than the normal charging cords which tend to split and break in the natural back-and-forth movement of the wire. Especially if you use your iPhone while you are charging. These are well-made, just the right length, and are designed to last a long time.

Great length, but doesn't wear as well as some cables I have worked with. Still looks like it could survive a year or two. Handles high-current charging and all compatible devices respond properly.-- Note: if you have a device that wont charge, leave lightning (smaller) end connected to device and reconnect USB side. This appears to be a fault of the power detection circuitry not waiting for a steady voltage to determine safe power source.

It stopped working in maybe 5 months 😞 looks good and the length is fantastic to sit and have something charged while doing things but that’s the only value to this. Wasn’t a charger supposed to last a long time? I had so much high hope for this cos it is braided fabric-ish not plastic but it literally doesn’t work. I unplug and plug and it starts charging, the moment I put down the device it says not charging.

This charging cable has lasted for almost a year of daily use. I am not soft on charging cables and compared to the standard ones that come with the iPhones, which only seem to last about 3-5 months on average, this braided cable has lasted me almost a year of comparable usage. I will not buy any more of those plastic coated cables that break and come apart so easily at the connector.
Cord does not work with iPhone 6 Plus or latest version of iPad mini. Looks like it's a good quality, major disappointment that it doesn't work.

...and I love it.  You should be satisfied.  The only way I can see someone being dissatisfied is if: (i) they have some weird case that blocks the tip (which I can barely imagine); or (ii) they did not realize how long the cord was, despite clear labels on Amazon that explicitly say how long it is).  You will, or at the very least should, like this charging cable.

Stopped charging my phone after 2 months of use. My daughters charger also stopped charging. My husband and son have had the Amazon Basics for 8 months and theirs still charges. So 50/50 chance yours will work I guess. I'm sticking with Apple.

Great cables. I am in the process of replacing several Apple cables that are disintegrating due to UV. I can't see spending the money on the Apple equivalent when the Amazon Basics cables work just as well. The paracord style woven cord is really nice and distinctive and seems to offer better protection. The length (6') is a bit long for countertop top use but is useful on the couch or in my older truck which has no handsfree or limited sockets so I need to charge a phone in the backseat.The only problem is that the housing on the lightning end is a bit large for some iPhone cases.

I always wait a bit to make a review, and this apple charging cable surpass my expectations. I was used to buy knock-off products because apple products are just too expensive, but this one feels like an apple product. The length of the cord and the durability make this charging cable just great. Cant recommend it enough.

Bought this to replace the (regular) AmazonBasics cables that I bought to replace the OEM apple cables. The regular amazonbasics cable lasted a couple years, which I guess isn't bad for the price.  I thought maybe this cable would be a little higher quality, and thus last a little longer. I use this cable to charge my phone on my nightstand so it gets used on a daily basis.Some reviews mentioned a problem with the contacts (i.e. device doesn't charge when you plug it in).  I actually have noticed that a few times (1% of use so far) but all it takes to resolve it is to remove & reinsert the plug.  The major selling point of this cable for me is that it easily fits my iPhone 6 Otterbox Defender case.

The cord feels sturdy, love the extra protection around the neck, which is where Apple cords tend to bend and fray the most. I love that they have the nylon braided cover which makes me feel it will hold up longer. The length is great - I bought one 6ft cord from Apple and needed another long length cord. Will definitely purchase again if I find the need.Update 4/5/2020: the cord recently stopped working so I got approximately three years use out of it. Wish it still worked, but $15 for three years seems okay to me.

Bought one of these to try out for a few weeks after Apple supplied ones went out. Thus far, have no issues with the ability to charge our iphone 6 and ipad Airs. Connectors seem durable and flexible. I am ordering more to replace other Apple OEM cables that are failing. Not the cheapest option, but appear to be built sturdy.

I can’t speak to the charging power of this device, but it feels heavy duty, and it’s as long as described. Those two criteria were more critical to me than charging power, because I don’t pay particular attention to that aspect of electronics. This cord seems to be durable and it functions well as a permanent charging cord for a high traffic couch outlet.

I love this. The length is great, and it doesn’t seem in danger of cracking when bent like other cords. Also, unlike any other non-Apple products I’ve bought, my devices, at least so far, haven’t rejected it. (Okay, that sounds weird. What I mean is that other off-brand cords stopped working after a while; the devices would say something like “Potentially harmful connector discovered.)

The cord seemed great, it felt sturdy with a strong/heavy outer cover. The length was exactly what I wanted but 32 days after purchase and one day after my eligible return date, the cord stopped working. The cord never left the side of my chair and was only used by one person. Very disappointed. I’ve tried to contact Amazon but no reply so far but given it’s the weekend and things are a mess with Covid19, I’ll be a little more patient. Hopefully I be able to get a new one or a credit.

I was super excited to find a long, iPhone charging cord from AmazonBasics, but I was also worried on the quality of the cable and how well it would charge. First of all, after weeks of use, I found that having a longer cable can save you in certain situations. Second! The nylon material is great and feels stronger than basic cables. And third, I haven't noticed anything bad about the charge. My phone chargers the same, if not better than the standard lightning cable. I recommend this charging cable, especially for the price!

I have a couple of the amazon basic cables for my iphones and they always feel thicker and more robust then the oem equipment ones even.  Never had a problem with them not working or breaking either.  The one I'm reviewing has a braided cloth like material over it that gives it a nicer look which is what my daughter wanted.  It's very long so you can not be attached directly to the wall socket.  Great product.

After about 1.5 years it only now charges if the USB-C end is turned w/ the Amazon Basics logo toward you. Also, if you use your phone while charging it will do some funny stuff sometimes ... I'm talking about phantom actions where the phone has a mind of it's own like it'll randomly send text messages you're composing before you want it to, etc. If you can deal with it falling apart and not being able to use it correctly while it's charging then it's great for $10, if not look elsewhere this is a really cheaply made product and previous versions were as well!

I like the look and they appear to be durable, however, they just don't work well.  I bought two, one for the car and one for inside the house.  If I'm driving and hit a bump, it pops right out of the phone and more often times than not, it's not secure enough to run Apple Car Play.  For the one in the house, I have to place the cord a certain way for it to stay charging.  It's very frustrating.

I had originally reviewed this as a two star product because it lasted 2 1/2 months. However, I just plugged it into a different power bar and it works fine. I believe the power bar I originally used was starting to “act up” and it was causing the problems with charging. I am therefore giving this charge wire a “5”.

Good quality Apple lightening cord alternative for a good price. I have had no problems with this cord not wanting to charge my phone and I have not received any of the "not supported" messages on my phone while using this product. The length is much nicer and sturdier than the standard cord that you receive with your phone.

I’m coming back to buy this item again since mine is finally starting to conk out on me. I looked in my order history and realized I’ve been using this cable for two years!! It is definitely an excellent value; mine has survived being carried everywhere, wrapped & unwrapped constantly, and getting chewed on by my cat. I highly recommend the 6’ length, especially if you’re like me and like to use your phone in bed.

One of the first cables after 5 plug in cycles!What absolute trash, and that’s were it goes. Moist of the cheap products with great reviews end up in the trash never to be sent back to Amazon, just disappointing considering how much I spend on Amazon monthly!

Bought this in Feb 2018, and only just now is the braided part at the base starting to get a little thin. This is because of how I hold it though, I need to get a right angle cable instead. Trusty cable and fits in my waterproof SEEBAY iPhone SE case without a need for an extender.Only a couple months ago the part that says “amazon basics” sometimes slides forward but doesn’t affect performance and pops right back into place

We have used AmazonBasics for other cable needs, and this one did not let us down. The color makes it distinct and easy to find among the other cables when needed. My iPhone has not had a problem with the connection, and the plug ends always make high-quality contact on both ends.  I'll keep using the brand until it fails me as a cost-effect alternative to that expensive factory variety.

Woke up in the middle of the night to my  fire alarm turning on as my Amazon iphone charging wire had started melting with a very bad smell of burnt plastic throughout my home.  Also burnt my hand.  Now have to replace five cables in my home

After ordering and returning a three pack of useless and damaged cords, I did my research and purchased this. No disappointments, no damaged pieces, charges well and feels strong and well made. It is certified Apple and I won’t choose anything without that approval again. Well worth every cent.

My sync cables tend to die after a year or so of rolling and unrolling, so I switched to braided cables. I've tried several brands, and the Amazon Basics ones seem to be just as good. I have yet to have one die on me.

I have wasted so much $ on other chords before and they stop charging or they get frayed. These are durable and are a great quality. I bought one for my car at first first and I loved it so much that I bought two more- one for me (home use), and  one for my husband. And I love that it doesn’t cost so much like the official Apple chargers either.

Don’t expect this charger to last, but you may get lucky and get a decent one sometimes.  I’ve bought them multiple times. The very first one I bought lasted about 8 months. But then every one after that has been starting to struggle after a few weeks. I get mad and say I won’t buy them again. Then when I go looking, the cheap price lures me in along with the fact that I got lucky with the first one, I buy another one in hopes that I’ll get another good one. I’m like an addict trying to chase that first high. Well Amazon. Well played..

This cord started out great! I was pretty happy with it! It was only a few months in and the cord stops working. I checked to see if it was the plug our out lit but it was the cord. I was pretty bummed out because my last cord lated for a few years. In don't recommend this product be cause it dies way too fast. I say look for a different cord on that will last you a few years in stead of this one lasting only a few months.

This cable is great and is a strong upgrade from the stock cables. Fees really high quality with rubberized end pieces and braided cabling. My only issue is that it sometimes feels stiff, but that’s a small price to pay for this awesome cable.UPDATE: I bought 2 more of these. They’re great!

I’m very not happy with this.  It is a great product for a time now I got about 6 of these cables. To charge my phone and my wife’s. Now I got mine maybe 2 months ago and now I only get this accessory may not be supported. And it stops charging my phone. I have now lost 3 of the 6 cables I got. I will not be getting any more.

Purchased this for my partner’s iPad but ended up using it to charge my iPad too.  We have it plugged into a USB wall outlet and so far, no overheating or issues.  I appreciate the speed in which this charges our iPads.  I prefer the nylon cords. They just look tidier to me and IMO seem more durable.

I bought this “durable” phone charger because mine always break and do that whole *charging, not charging... charging... not charging* thing and I thought this one looked like it would last. I’ve only had it for a little over a month and it stopped working unless I kink the wire in one specific spot 😩The length was great but not worth it since it’s useless one month later.

I’ve had this for over a year. See all the reviews about fires never had an issue. My husbands leaves his IPhone 10 plunged in all night.  I use it in the morning and it seems to charge faster than other charging cables, my phone is charged in 20 minutes from almost out of power. I recommend this.

Excellent quality. Apple products don’t complain about it not being a genuine Apple cable. My family (Teens) are death on Apple Lightening cables. These will take the abuse and keep working. Be advised that the shield on the plug that goes to IPhone is a larger diameter than genuine Apple cable. It may not fit into the phone with certain cases (Lifeproof, Otterbox, etc) But otherwise I love this cable.

Was working great for a few days, and now it doesn’t always work with my iPhone 6s. It’s like as if the wires inside the cord are broken in some minor places and depending on the cords direction it will work. I have to kink it back and forth and find a specific spot. Worked great what first few days. Then it’s very touchy. And shorter than I anticipated it to be.

These are by far my favorite chargers, and I always re-purchase when it is time for a new one because they work so well! Charge is pretty quick, there are multiple lengths for different needs, and the braid keeps it from falling apart like normal chargers after extended use. I have multiple of these throughout my house, in all different colors, and they always last me a long time!

After using this cord for a couple of months daily, I really like it. I guess I am rough on cords. Generally cheap cords will fray and break towards the end with the lightning connector. This cord has held up quite well. It is pretty stiff compared to other cords, I hope this is a sign of how well built it is. This also has a far better price (less than half) of a comparable cord you can buy in a store. I have become a big fan of Amazon Basics products.

After buying a Amazon Basics laptop bag for over half of what other bags cost I was sold. This Basics line is really good. Not at all what one might think of with a "store brand" or generic. This is one of two braided cables I have bought as the silicon kind fall apart and wear out really fast. The Amazon one is going strong. Neck and neck quality with my other "brand name" cable. Keep it up Amazon.

My cat loves electronic cords. The skinnier they are, the better. Our iphone charging cables are a constant target. We've gone through so many of them. Finally decided to spend the money on one of these braided cords and it was SO worth it. She can't chew through the braid, so we can finally have the cord out without worrying about it being destroyed.

So far so good. I bought this and have been using it every day since. I have it at my desk at work. I have a little phone stand i purchased and plug my charging cable into my phone at the bottom of the stand.When not plugged in the cable seems to keep the shape it was in while plugged in. Just makes me question if the cable will wear out prematurely from staying bent. I could be totally wrong (which is why i gave it a good 4 star rating).

I needed a durable cord that was long since my power outlets aren’t nearly by my seats or my bedside. It charges fast when you’re not using your device but not so much when its charging and you ARE using it. Regardless I love the color and my kids know to not touch it because it’s moms charger lol

I had this charger as my daily charger for 1.5 years. It’s finally shorting out of me. Right under the charge port part I guess there’s a loose connection because it will go back and forth between charging and not charging. But for it to last me almost 2 years with no problems I’d say I definitely got my money’s worth from this product. I would definitely purchase again.

So far so good, I have had this cord for a little while now and I see no signs of pulling apart, which is great. I keep this cord by my bed, and my only issue with it is the velcro wrap to keep it together. I like having the wrap there for when I do want to bundle it up, or when I am traveling, so I a glad its there. I just find it mildly annoying when it gets stuck to things or scratched against me skin. Im sure you could easily take it off though, its not that big of a deal. So far it is definitely better than the regular cords I have bought in the past. I would definitely recommend this product.

I really didn't want to order a charger from Apple since they do not last long. I had bought a similar charger to this one a few years ago from radio shack. It worked great and lasted many years in comparison to the Apple ones.What attracted me to this charger was the length, material, and rose gold color. I trusted the quality of this item because it was from amazon.

Ordered November 21. Today is May 5 and still works great. Have had no issues and just ordered another. I’ve bought several of the less expensive ones but they eventually stop working and the phone gives the “accessory not supported” error and they stop working with a computer.I’ve had no issues with this one. Has worked great.

Used the charger for my daughter's iPhone 7+, worked great for a couple of weeks until it just stopped charging her phone. Changed outlets, adapters and iPhone type and it still did not charge. There was no physical damage done to the charger and we still don't know why it just stopped working. Everything else about the product worked fine though.

LOVE this charger, I've been using it for a couple months now and have had no issues. Charges my phone extremely fast & is more than long enough. The braided texture of the chord really protects it from damage and makes it long lasting. Additionally, comes with a little velcro piece attached to the chord to wrap it up to take on the go. Exactly as described, very happy customer!

Husband says this one is just ok. Our other charger works better. He likes the length and the durability of it. Wouldn’t return, but probably wouldn’t buy again. Said he was playing a game on the iPad and the charge actually went down. If your not using it it charges it normally.

My kids DESTROY cables. Up to two weeks ago, I ranged between 8 hrs. and 2 days for every cable I purchased. As you likely know, if you're in the  Apple/Lightning cable market, these are not cheap. These have been surprisingly durable. Note the flexible reinforcement between the cable and the connector housing. This feature has proven worth the extra cost, which is still LESS THAN HALF that of Apple-brand cables. Couldn't be happier with this purchase...unless it washed my car, too.

This is probably the best charging cord I’ve gotten. It seems very durable and well made. It charges my iPhone quickly without the cord feeling too warm. I really like the thick, braided outer core; it doesn’t kink like some I’ve had. The length is good for my use. This is one I’d recommend.

This USB iPhone charger cable works great. I especially like the braided cord because the usual plastic cords break so easily. The only thing I would give a heads up about is it stopped working (after using it for a year or so) when I used my normal iPhone wall plug that the USB fits in. But when I switched to a random, stronger plug, it worked again at full strength.

I thought this cord was great at first, but 2.5 months after using it, it doesn’t work all the time. There must be a short somewhere. When I plug my phone in it goes from charging to not charging to charging again over and over really fast and doesn’t stop doing it. I was hoping it would last a little longer than it did.

I purchased this item a little over a month ago and it has no stopped working. I have tried different phones, different boxes, different outlets and it charges my phone for about a minute and then it stops working. It is not my phone because it has not worked on other phones and I have a car charger that works perfectly fine. Highly disappointed!

i’ve had this cable for a little over a year now and it’s held up pretty good for a years worth of use but it is breaking around the lightning port and same with another one i have which stopped working completely, and this cord only works on one side at this point.  Also I’m not sure if this is just me but sometimes when i charge with this cord it only charges my phone to 80%, it happened when i had a 6s and then when i got the 8 and more recently a 2 weeks ago the Xs and sometimes i would leave my phone overnightto charge and it would only reach 80% max so i had to use a different cord. Overall overtime this cord has gotten worse and worse and has multiple issues but it’s pretty good for short term use i guess, it last a little longer than the apple ones though.

I purchased this 6ft cable since it had a higher gauge wires which decreases the voltage drop due to the 6ft length.  I've purchased several of their 3ft cables and was very happy with them.  However, the 6ft cable failed after a month or so of use.  I cleaned the contacts and noticed that the lightning cable "tab" flexes which may be the cause of the issue.  I did not see this issue on the 3ft cables so this may be a defective cable.

This doesn't include a wall change, so maybe that part of the problem, I can leave this plugged in for 8 hours and still only get a 30% charge. Often time no charge at all. I have to play with it.Stay away from this after market chargers seldom perform compared to and official apple product.

I have bought these Amazon basic cords several times over the past few years.  However, this latest cord I purchased is not the same quality as I have gotten in the past.  The cord is already beginning to show a weak point right under the rubber protection at the top of the cord.  I've only had the cord a couple of months and I will be lucky to get another month or two out of it.

AmazonBasics are the absolute best value cables that you can buy. We have five iPhones in my house and we burn through cables like crazy. We have tried about 10 different brands and you can't beat these for the price. I also love the color options so that I can get everyone a different color so I can tell when someone "borrows" mine.

I bought a couple of the AmazonBasics chargers a few months ago with the plastic casing around the cords, and they still work fine. I wanted to get a braided case one for work, so I bought another brand that was not MFi certified and of course got the dreaded pop up. I was happy to see Amazon offered the braided version and ordered 2! Not only is the plastic casing around the usb plug larger than the same manufacturers other chargers, the lightning end casing is larger too, which doesn’t work with my case (which i’ve never had any issue with any other charger not fitting!) so now I’ve wasted $25 on something I don’t feel like paying more money to send back and return 🙄

These seem to work great esp for the price but sometimes they randomly stop working on one "side" so despite the lightning cable being switchable in the port, you still end up having to place it in your phone in a specific way. Sometimes it's like that forever. Sometimes it does that for a few days and then works properly both ways again.

I own 3 of these nylon braided cords and I will probably own more in the future when I need more. They are the best, durable, and long. the only thing is the little velcro that comes with it to coil it up ends up falling off and I lose it. But these are my go to for charger cords.

I have bought a couple of these charging cords and every one of them have worked fine. I highly recommend these, I’ve been using them for more than a year and they continue to work well. I have one in my car one next to my bed and one in my dining room so they all get used quite often. Have not had any trouble with them.

This charger came on time, was durable, and looked nice. I plugged my phone into it right away, and saw that it said that the phone was charging. I go watch tv while it’s charging and when I come back, the phone is on the same battery level! Is only says it’s charging, it doesn’t actually charge. I thought “well maybe I should try another outlet”. Same result. I use a different adapter and the same freaking thing happens. It only says it’s charging but doesn’t actually charge. And when I use it that battery goes down when it’s plugged in! I thought with all of the good reviews that this charger would be great, but I was totally wrong. Twelve dollars for a charger when a five dollar one gets the job actually done. Really disappointed.

DO NOT USE!!! I loved mine at first until it almost caught on fire. It started to smell like something was burning and then I noticed a couple discolored spots on the cord. The spots were warm to the touch and smelled like char.

These last much longer than the other replacement cords we have purchased.  I recommend spending a little more money and getting the amazonbasics.  Worth it in the end.  Last almost a year for us (and my sons are tough on cords for some reason).  Or if you prefer get the really cheap ones and just realize you will go through them about each month or so.
